THE DINGELL JOHNSON SPORT FISH RESTORATION ACT (16 U.S.C. 777 ET SEQ.) AND THE PITTMAN ROBERTSON WILDLIFE RESTORATION ACT (16 U.S.C. 669 ET SEQ.), AS AMENDED BY THE WILDLIFE AND SPORT FISH RESTORATION PROGRAMS IMPROVEMENT ACT OF 2000 (PUB. L. 106 408, 114 STAT. 1766  113 AND 114 STAT. 1722  122) AUTHORIZE THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR TO MAKE UP TO  6,000,000 AVAILABLE ANNUALLY UNDER THE WILDLIFE AND SPORT FISH RESTORATION PROGRAM (WSFR) TO FUND MULTISTATE CONSERVATION PROJECT GRANTS. IN ADDITION TO THE TRADITIONALLY  6,000,000 AVAILABLE FUNDING ( 3,000,000 FOR WILDLIFE RESTORATION AND  3,000,000 FOR SPORTFISH RESTORATION), THE PRESIDENT SIGNED THE MODERNIZING THE PITTMAN ROBERTSON FUND FOR TOMORROW S NEEDS ACT (MODERNIZING PR ACT) (PUBLIC LAW (PUB. L.) 116 94) INTOLAW ON DECEMBER 20, 2019. THIS LAW, AMONG OTHER MEASURES, CREATED A NEW  MODERN MULTISTATE CONSERVATION GRANT PROGRAM  DESIGNED TO SUPPORT  R3  PROJECTS FOR HUNTING AND SHOOTING SPORTS. THE M MSCGP WILL MAKE UP TO AN ADDITIONAL  5,000,000 AVAILABLE FOR THE HUNTER AND RECREATIONAL SHOOTER RECRUITMENT RELATED GRANTS, INCLUDING RELATED COMMUNICATION AND OUTREACH ACTIVITIES. THESE ACTS DID NOT PROVIDE ANY ADMINISTRATIVE FUNDS FOR THE ASSOCIATION S USE IN ADMINISTERING AND IMPLEMENTING ITS SIGNIFICANT RESPONSIBILITIES UNDER THIS GRANT PROGRAM. IN 2022 THE ASSOCIATION WAS AWARDED A ONE YEAR MULTISTATE CONSERVATION GRANT THAT CURRENTLY SUPPORTS THROUGH DECEMBER 2022 THE MULTISTATE CONSERVATION GRANT PROGRAM MANAGER. THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE IS TO CONTINUE MEETING THE RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE ASSOCIATION AS REQUIRED UNDER THE FEDERAL AUTHORIZING LEGISLATION FOR ADMINISTERING AND COORDINATING THE MSCGP. HOWEVER, ADDITIONAL EMPHASIS WILL BE PLACED ON PROGRAM EVALUATION AND THE COMMUNICATION OF PROGRAM RESULTS. PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT WILL ALSO REMAIN A PRIORITY, AND THE MSCGP MANAGER WILL CONTINUE TO ATTEND PERTINENT GRANT ADMINISTRATIVE TRAINING. AS A PROGRAM MANAGER FACILITATOR, THE MSCGP MANAGER WILL WORK TO MAXIMIZE THE BENEFITSTO THE STATE FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES THROUGHOUT THE GRANT CYCLE AND THE GRANT PROPOSAL SELECTION PROCESS.THE MSCGP MANAGER MANAGES THE ACTIVITIES THAT IMPLEMENT THE GRANT PROGRAM. THIS PROJECT WOULD PROVIDE CONTINUED PROGRAM MANAGER FUNDING AND SUPPORT THOSE ADMINISTRATIVE RESPONSIBILITIES NECESSARY TO IMPLEMENT THE MULTISTATE CONSERVATION GRANT PROGRAM.

A MAJOR CHALLENGE AFFECTING OUR RECRUITMENT, RETENTION, AND REACTIVATION EFFORTS TODAY IS THAT PROGRAMS HAVE HISTORICALLY BEEN HELD AS ONE AND DONE EVENTS. PARTICIPANTS CONTINUE TO LACK THE CONFIDENCE AND COMPETENCE NEEDED TO BECOME SELF IDENTIFIED HUNTERS AFTER THESE SINGLE DAY RECRUITMENT EFFORTS. ADDITIONALLY, THE CHURN RATE REGARDING WOMEN IN HUNTING AND SHOOTING SPORTS IS A PROBLEM WE LOOK TO EXAMINE AND ADDRESS. LAST YEAR, THE CALIFORNIA WATERFOWL ASSOCIATION AND CHRISTINE THOMAS, FOUNDER OF THE BECOMING AND OUTDOORS WOMAN PROGRAM, SPEARHEADED A MAJOR NATIONAL STUDY TO IDENTIFY THE R3 NEEDS AND OPPORTUNITIES OF FEMALE HUNTERS, SHOOTERS, AND ARCHERS. IT IS CRITICAL THAT THE WEALTH OF KNOWLEDGE GAINED THROUGH THIS NATIONAL STUDY ON WOMEN IN THE OUTDOORS NOT BE WASTED, THERE IS AN IMMEDIATE NEED AND A MAJOR OPPORTUNITY TO RETAIN THESE WOMEN BY PROVIDING THEM WITH THE NEXT STEPS SPECIFIC TO THEIR EXPERIENCE AND INTEREST LEVELS.OUR PROPOSAL ONE BUT NOT DONE PROJECT WILL BUILD ON THE PREVIOUS RESEARCH BY TAKING THE INFORMATION GAINED FROM THE 2021 STUDY AND PUTTING IT INTO ACTION THROUGH A COORDINATED NATIONAL EFFORT. USING THE LESSONS LEARNED AND QUESTIONS ANSWERED IN LAST YEAR S STUDY, THIS FOLLOW UP PROJECT WILL CAPITALIZE ON THE EXISTING DATASET OF MORE THAN 10,000 FEMALE HUNTERS, SHOOTERS, ARCHERS AND R3 PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS BY DIRECTING THESE INDIVIDUALS TO FOLLOW UP EVENTS AND PROGRAMS THAT PROVIDE THEM WITH THE NEXT STEPS TO BECOMING INDEPENDENT OUTDOORSWOMEN.THE PURPOSE OF THE PROJECT IS TO ENSURE THAT MOMENTUM IS NOT LOST BY BUILDING ON THE EXISTING DATASET OF FEMALE PARTICIPANTS AND IMPLEMENTING THE PREVIOUS STUDY S RESEARCH FINDINGS, THIS PROJECT WILL ENTAIL CONCRETE ACTIONS TO RETAIN CURRENT FEMALE PARTICIPANTS.TO INITIATE THE PROJECT, THE TEAM WILL CONVENE A NATIONAL WORKSHOP OF R3 PRACTITIONERS AND EVENT PARTNERS TO PRESENT THE LESSONS LEARNED AND FINDINGS OF THE 2021 RESEARCH.DURING THIS WORKSHOP, PARTNERS AND R3 PRACTITIONERS WILL WORK TOGETHER TO DEVELOP A ROBUST INVENTORY AND CALENDAR OF UPCOMING 2023 EVENTS TOSHARE AND PROVIDE WOMEN WITH THE NECESSARY NEXT STEPS TO INCREASE THEIR COMPETENCE AND CONFIDENCE INHUNTING AND SHOOTING SPORTS.THE NEXT PHASE OF THE PROJECT ENTAILS STAKEHOLDER INVOLVEMENT AND ENGAGEMENT  THE PROJECT TEAM WILLCOORDINATE WITH ALL WOMEN S R3 EVENT AND PROGRAM PRACTITIONERS TO PREPARE INVITATIONS AND INFORMATIONTO PROVIDE THE POOL OF MORE THAN 10,000 FEMALE HUNTERS, SPORT SHOOTERS, AND ARCHERS.THE THIRD PHASE OF THE PROJECT WILL TAKE PLACE AT THE END OF 2023  THE PROJECT TEAM WILL RE INTERVIEW WOMEN FROM THE DATASET TO DETERMINE WHICH EVENTS THEY COMPLETED  HOW THEIR PARTICIPATION IN THEACTIVITIES CHANGED  HOW THEY NOW RATE THEIR COMPETENCE, CONFIDENCE, AUTONOMY, SKILLS, AND OTHERFACTORS  AND WHICH VARIABLES MOST IMPACTED THEIR CONTINUED INVOLVEMENT IN THE ACTIVITIES.THIS PROJECT WILL BUILD ON RECENT R3 RESEARCH BY TAKING THE INFORMATION GAINED FROM A MAJOR 2021 STUDY WITH FEMALEHUNTERS, SPORT SHOOTERS, AND ARCHERS AND PUTTING IT INTO ACTION THROUGH A COORDINATED NATIONAL EFFORT. THE PROJECT ENTAILS A MAJOR  PRE  AND  POST  EVALUATION TO SYSTEMATICALLY DETERMINE THE MOST IMPORTANT RESOURCES, SUPPORT, ANDOTHER FACTORS TO INCREASE AND MAINTAIN WOMEN S PARTICIPATION. THIS UNIQUE LONGITUDINAL PROJECT WILL PROVIDE ESSENTIAL PATHWAYS ACROSS AGENCIES AND ORGANIZATIONS TO CURRENT PARTICIPANTS AND ASSESS THE IMPACT OF SINGLE AND MULTI DAY EVENTS AND FOLLOW UP OPPORTUNITIES. THE PROJECT WILL GENERATE NEW ACTIONABLE RETENTION RECOMMENDATIONS THAT THECOMMUNITY CAN IMMEDIATELY PUT INTO USE.

WHILE STATE FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES HAVE KNOWN WILDLIFE VIEWING IS A GROWING ACTIVITY IN THE UNITED STATES FOR DECADES, THEY HAVE LACKED THE DATA TO TRULY UNDERSTAND HOW TO ENGAGE THIS AUDIENCE IN WAYS THAT CREATE SUPPORT FOR CONSERVATION INITIATIVES, MAKE AGENCIES MORE RELEVANT TO NEW AUDIENCES, AND EMPLOY PROVEN APPROACHES FOR CREATING REVENUE GENERATING INITIATIVES FOR VIEWING. THAT DATA IS NOW AVAILABLE FROM PHASE 1 OF THIS PROJECT   A NATIONAL SURVEY OF WILDLIFE VIEWERS   CONDUCTED BY VIRGINIA TECH IN COLLABORATION WITH THE WILDLIFE VIEWING AND  NATURE TOURISM WORKING GROUP THROUGH THE SUPPORT OF A 2021 MULTISTATE CONSERVATION GRANT. FUNDING FROM THE PROPOSED 2023 GRANT WILL SUPPORT A PHASE 2, ENABLING RESEARCHERS FROM VIRGINIA TECH TO CONTINUE TO WORK WITH STATE AGENCIES TO ENSURE SUCCESSFUL IMPLEMENTATION OF THE FINDINGS OF THE SURVEY.IN CONSULTATION WITH MORE THAN 30 STATE AGENCIES DURING PHASE 1 OF THE WILDLIFE VIEWER SURVEY PROJECT, STATE AGENCY STAFF STATED THAT THEY WOULD GREATLY BENEFIT FROM DEDICATED, STRUCTURED SUPPORT FOR IMPLEMENTING NEW PROJECTS BASED ON SURVEY RECOMMENDATIONS, EFFORTS TO BUILD BUY IN AND SUPPORT FOR WILDLIFE VIEWING WITHIN THEIR AGENCIES, ACCESS TO A CENTRAL INFORMATION SOURCE WITH INSPIRING CASE STUDIES, AND ADDITIONAL INFORMATION ON WILDLIFE VIEWERS FROM URBAN AREAS TO SUPPORT STATE AGENCIES AS THEY EXPAND, OR IN SOME CASES CREATE FOR THE FIRST TIME, THEIR STATE S WILDLIFE VIEWING PROGRAMS. FUNDING FOR PHASE 2 FROM THIS GRANT WILL ENABLE VIRGINIA TECH RESEARCHERS TO PROVIDE PRESENTATIONS AND OR TRAININGS AT A VARIETY OF ASSOCIATION OF FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCY MEETINGS AND OTHER CONFERENCES TYPICALLY ATTENDED BY STATE AGENCY STAFF, PROVIDE MORE IN DEPTH INFORMATION ON WILDLIFE VIEWERS, AND GUIDE STATES AS THEY IMPLEMENT EFFORTS TO ENGAGE VIEWERS  THROUGH A COMMUNITY OF PRACTICE, RESEARCHERS AND STATE WILDLIFE AGENCY PEERS WILL WORK TOGETHER TO CREATE EFFECTIVE STATE BASED VIEWING EFFORTS, STRIVING TO ACHIEVE THESE FINAL RECOMMENDATIONS FROM THE PHASE 1 SURVEY REPORT 1. RESPOND TO DEMAND FOR AGENCIES TO DEVELOP PROGRAMS AND ENGAGE VIEWERS2. BROADEN CONSTITUENCIES FOR AGENCIES THROUGH VIEWING SUPPORT WITH UNDERSERVED GROUPS3. DEVELOP FINANCIAL SUPPORT OPPORTUNITIES FOR VIEWERS TO CONTRIBUTE TO STATE AGENCIESTHROUGH A WEB BASED STORY MAP, RESEARCHERS AND STATES WILL SHARE THESE NEW EFFORTS BY AGENCIES TO ENGAGE VIEWERS, AND PROVIDE EXAMPLES FOR OTHER STATES INTERESTED IN DOING THE SAME IN THE FUTURE. ADDITIONALLY, WEBINARS AND PRESENTATIONS INTRODUCING THE STORY MAP AND SHARING LESSONS LEARNED WILL FURTHER THE REACH OF THE WORK ON THIS PROJECT, ENSURING USE BY STATES AFTER THE CONCLUSION OF PHASE 2. ALL STATE AGENCIES WILL BE BETTER POSITIONED TO BE RELEVANT TO NEW AUDIENCES, INCREASE PARTICIPATION IN WILDLIFE VIEWING RECREATION, AND POTENTIALLY CREATE NEW FUNDING MECHANISMS AS A RESULT OF THIS GRANT. SUCCESS STORIES FROM STATES WILL HIGHLIGHT A WAY FORWARD TOWARD GREATER RELEVANCY BY USING DATA ON WILDLIFE VIEWER PREFERENCES AND ACTIVITIES.

THERE IS A NEED TO UNDERSTAND FACTORS THAT INCREASE RISK OF SEVERE MANGE IN WILDLIFE AND FOR AGENCIES TO EFFECTIVELY MANAGE AND CONSERVE BLACK BEAR POPULATIONS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS 1 YEAR PROJECT IS TO ENGAGE WITH NUMEROUS WILDLIFE AGENCIES TO DEVELOP STANDARDIZED APPROACHES FOR THE MANAGEMENT AND SURVEILLANCE OF MANGE IN AMERICAN BLACK BEARS AND TO CONDUCT APPLIED AND HUMAN DIMENSIONS RESEARCH STUDIES THAT WILL PROVIDE DATA TO IMPROVE MANAGEMENT OF BLACK BEARS. SARCOPTIC MANGE IS A QUINTESSENTIAL ONE HEALTH DISEASE OF HUNDREDS OF WILD AND DOMESTIC SPECIES THAT RESULTS IN HAIR LOSS, EMACIATION AND MORTALITY IN SEVERE CASES. SARCOPTIC MANGE IN BLACK BEARS HAS BEEN REPORTED FROM A GROWING LIST OF STATES AND IS A CONCERN FOR INDIVIDUAL BEAR HEALTH, PUBLIC PERCEPTION, AND THE POTENTIAL FOR LOCALIZED POPULATION EFFECTS, YET THE UNDERLYING CAUSE OF THIS EMERGENCE REMAINS UNCLEAR. NOTABLY, SINCE 2017, BEAR MANGE HAS EMERGED IN SEVERAL NEW STATES AND HAS BECOME A GROWING ISSUE IN ENDEMIC STATES. ALTHOUGH SARCOPTIC MANGE IS THE MOST COMMON FORM, MITE IDENTIFICATION IS NEEDED IN EACH CASE TO RULE OUT ONE OF THE OTHER THREE SPECIES OF MANGE MITES OR TO DETECT NOVEL MITES (E.G., CHORIOPTES WAS NOT KNOWN TO CAUSE BEAR MANGE UNTIL 2020). THERE IS A NEED FOR STATES TO HAVE A STANDARDIZED APPROACH TO INVESTIGATING THE IMPACT OF MANGE ON BEAR POPULATIONS. THIS INCLUDES SAMPLE COLLECTION, TESTING, REPORTING, RESPONSE TO INDIVIDUAL ANIMALS, RESPONSE TO PUBLIC INQUIRIES, ETC. WE WILL DEVELOP A SYSTEMATIC DATA COLLECTION PROTOCOL AND DEVELOP COUNTY LEVEL INTERACTIVE MAPS THROUGH COLLABORATIONS WITH STATE AGENCIES. THE STANDARDIZED DATA SUBMISSION PROCESS (WEB PORTAL, EXCEL SHEET, SCWDS SUBMISSION, OR COMBINATION OF THESE) WILL CONTINUE AFTER THE GRANT THROUGH SCWDS STATE AGREEMENTS. WE WILL ALSO DEVELOP A WEBSITE THAT HOSTS THIS MAP AND DATA AS WELL AS OTHER INFORMATION GENERATED DURING THIS GRANT (E.G., INFO SHEETS ON WILDLIFE MANGE, COMMUNICATION MATERIALS, TRAINING MATERIALS (E.G., VIDEOS), ETC.). THIS ENSURES THAT ALL STATE FEDERAL AGENCIES, NGOS, WILDLIFE REHABILITATORS, ETC. HAVE ACCESS TO INFORMATION THAT HAS BEEN DEVELOPED AND VETTED BY BIOLOGISTS, VETERINARIANS, AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS. THIS PROPOSAL ALSO ADDRESSES SEVERAL APPLIED RESEARCH NEEDS THAT WILL HELP UNDERSTAND FACTORS THAT INCREASE RISK OF SEVERE MANGE. THE FIRST STUDY INVESTIGATES MITE BURDENS FROM DIFFERENT REGIONS OF THE BODY. THIS STUDY SERVES TWO PURPOSES. FIRST, TO DETERMINE IF MITE BURDENS CORELATE WITH MANGE SEVERITY OR OUTCOME AND SECONDLY, THESE DATA HAVE AN APPLIED APPLICATION RELATED TO DIAGNOSTIC SAMPLING. LOW OR VARIATION IN MITE BURDENS IN CERTAIN REGIONS OF THE BODY MAY RESULT IN AN ANIMAL BEING INCORRECTLY CALLED NEGATIVE. THE SECOND PROPOSED STUDY IS RELATED TO TOXIN EXPOSURE, IN PARTICULAR ANTICOAGULANT RODENTICIDES (AR). WILDLIFE ARE EXPOSED TO NUMEROUS TOXINS AND THOSE INDIVIDUALS THAT LIVE IN AND AROUND HUMANS MAY BE AT INCREASED RISK OF EXPOSURE. MORTALITY DUE TO LEAD OR ANTICOAGULANT EXPOSURE HAS BEEN WELL DOCUMENTED, BUT SOME TOXINS MAY HAVE LONG TERM OR INDIRECT EFFECTS WHICH ARE POORLY UNDERSTOOD, ALTHOUGH MANY CAN IMPAIR IMMUNE COMPETENCE. THERE ARE MULTIPLE STUDIES THAT SUGGEST THAT EXPOSURE OF WILDLIFE TO TOXICANTS CAN INCREASE THEIR RISK OF CLINICAL MANGE. FINALLY, NOT ALL INDIVIDUALS WITH MANGE DIE OR NEED TO BE EUTHANIZED, BUT THIS HIGHLY VISIBLE DISEASE CHALLENGES MANAGERS, AS PUBLIC CONCERNS OVER ANIMAL WELFARE ARE COMMON. WE WILL CONDUCT HUMAN DIMENSIONS RESEARCH TO DEVELOP EFFECTIVE COMMUNICATION STRATEGIES TO ASSIST WILDLIFE AGENCIES. HOWEVER, THE PUBLIC OFTEN OPPOSES EUTHANASIA, BASED ON THEIR VALUES, ATTITUDES, BELIEFS AND INCOMPLETE KNOWLEDGE OF DISEASE. TO IMPROVE MANAGEMENT, DATA ARE NEEDED TO IDENTIFY COMMUNICATION MESSAGES TAILORED TO PEOPLE WITH DIFFERENT CORE VALUES TO ENGENDER SUPPORT FOR MANAGEMENT OF MANGE. THIS PROJECT BENEFITS AT LEAST 26 STATES.

THE NATIONAL SURVEY OF HUNTING FISHING AND WILDLIFE ASSOCIATED RECREATION IS THE PREMIER SURVEY FOR THE COLLECTION OF HUNTING AND FISHING PARTICIPATION DATA WHICH IS INTEGRAL TO PLANNING AND COMMUNICATIONS AT STATE FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES, THE US FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE, AND A MYRIAD OF GROUPS INVOLVED IN CONSERVATION. IT ALSO REPRESENTS A SIGNIFICANT INVESTMENT OF FUNDING BY THE ASSOCIATION OF FISH AND  WILDLIFE AGENCIES THROUGH THE MULTI STATE CONSERVATION GRANT PROGRAM. ENSURING THE STATISTICAL VALIDITY AND RIGOR OF THE SURVEY IS OF UTMOST IMPORTANCE AND IS THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE ASSOCIATION THROUGH THE NATIONAL SURVEY TECHNICAL WORKGROUP (NSTWG), WHICH CONSISTS OF MEMBERS OF STATE FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES AND A TECHNICAL CONSULTANT.MORE SPECIFICALLY, IN 2023 THE NSTWG WILL FOCUS ITS EFFORTS ON THE FOLLOWING   REVIEW AND VALIDATION OF STATISTICAL VALIDITY OF DATA  OVERSIGHT OF USFWS COORDINATOR  PROBLEM SOLVING WHERE THE NEED IS IDENTIFIED  REVIEW OF THE PUBLIC RELEASE OF REPORTS AND DATA INCLUDING  REVIEW OF TANGENTIAL REPORTS AND DATA SETS (BIRD WATCHING, WILDLIFE WATCHING, ETC...)  DEVELOPMENT OF RECOMMENDATION REGARDING THE NEXT POSSIBLE SURVEY IN 2027

AWARD PURPOSE  RECENT DECLINES IN POPULATION NUMBERS AND DIMINISHED REPRODUCTIVE SUCCESS IN WILD TURKEYS ACROSS MUCH OF THE US HAVE PROMPTED THE URGENT NEED FOR INVESTIGATIONS INTO CONTRIBUTING AND CAUSATIVE FACTORS. WITHOUT CONCERTED EFFORTS TO UNDERSTAND THE REASONS BEHIND THESE DECLINES THAT THREATEN WILD TURKEY POPULATION HEALTH, THESE DOWNWARD TRENDS LIKELY WILL CONTINUE. LYMPHOPROLIFERATIVE DISEASE VIRUS (LPDV) IS A RECENTLY CHARACTERIZED RETROVIRUS THAT HAS BEEN DETECTED IN WILD TURKEYS IN ALL AREAS SURVEYED THUS FAR, AND HAS STEADILY RAISED CONCERNS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  OBJECTIVE 1. WE WILL PERFORM AN EXPERIMENTAL INFECTION TRIAL OF LYMPHOPROLIFERATIVE DISEASE VIRUS IN WILD TURKEYS TO GENERATE DATA ON INFECTION AND DISEASE PREVALENCE BY DIFFERENT INOCULATION METHODS, EVALUATE VIRAL SHEDDING AND PERSISTENCE IN BLOOD, EFFECTS ON CLINICAL HEALTH AND BEHAVIOR, AND DEVELOPMENT AND SEVERITY OF DISEASE. DATA WILL BE COMPILED, MANAGED INTO A DATABASE FOR INTERPRETATION, SYNTHESIZED (AND INTERPRETED), ANALYZED AND REPORTED. STRATEGY  RESEARCH, SURVEY,OBJECTIVE 2. THIS OBJECTIVE INCLUDES COMMUNICATION OUTREACH TO A DIVERSITY OF STAKEHOLDER GROUPS THAT CAN USE THE RESEARCH DATA GENERATED  OUR GOAL IS TO INCREASE AWARENESS OF OUR RESEARCH IMPLICATIONS AND SPECIFICALLY WHAT THEY MEAN TO WILD TURKEY HEALTH AND CONSERVATION. BROADLY, OUR COMMUNICATIONS WILL ENCOMPASS DISTRIBUTION OF RESEARCH FINDINGS IN THE FORM OF PROJECT SUMMARIES IN NEWSLETTERS, ANNUAL STAKEHOLDER REPORTS AND SCIENTIFIC PUBLICATION, AS WELL AS VIA PRESENTATIONS AT WEBINARS, CONFERENCES, SOCIAL MEDIA AND OTHER VENUES TARGETED TO PROJECT STAKEHOLDERS.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES  THE DELIVERABLES FROM THIS STUDY WILL INCLUDE PRESENTATIONS TO DIVERSE AUDIENCES INCLUDING STUDENTS INTERESTED OR OPEN TO LEARNING ABOUT WILDLIFE CONSERVATION, GRADUATE STUDENTS, HUNTERS, CONSERVATIONISTS AND WILDLIFE ENTHUSIASTS, WILDLIFE AND NATURAL RESOURCE BIOLOGISTS, MANAGERS AND ADMINISTRATORS WITH BOTH STATE AND FEDERAL AGENCIES, UNIVERSITY AND GOVERNMENT SCIENTISTS, AND OTHERS. INFORMATION WILL BE SYNTHESIZED AND TAILORED TO EACH APPLICABLE STAKEHOLDER GROUP AS PRESENTATIONS AT ANNUAL SEAFWA, NEAFWA AND OTHER REGIONAL MEETINGS, AS WELL AS REGIONAL WILDLIFE HEALTH AND WILD TURKEY TECHNICAL GROUP MEETINGS, AND SCIENTIFIC CONFERENCES AIMED AT WILDLIFE SCIENTISTS AND MANAGERS, UNIVERSITY GROUPS, PROFESSIONAL ASSOCIATION GROUPS, HUNTER GROUPS, AND OTHERS. PRESENTATIONS AT CONFERENCES ARE AVAILABLE TO HUNDREDS OF ATTENDEES AND ABSTRACTS ARE SUBSEQUENTLY ACCESSIBLE BY ALL, INCLUDING THE GENERAL PUBLIC. AS A REGIONAL COOPERATIVE, SCWDS HAS CONTACT WITH 17 MEMBER STATE WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT AGENCIES, THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OFAGRICULTURE, U.S. FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE, AND U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY, WHICH PROVIDE ADDITIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR OUTREACH AND COMMUNICATION. THESE ACTIVITIES ARE EXPECTED TO REACH THOUSANDS OF PARTICIPANTS THAT ACCESS SOCIAL MEDIA, INTERNET, AND PRESS INFORMATION VIA INTERNET AND PRINT.STUDY FINDINGS ALSO WILL BE BROADLY DISSEMINATED BOTH DURING AND AFTER COMPLETION TO GOVERNMENT, PUBLIC,ACADEMIC, AND PRIVATE SECTORS VIA WEBSITES, WEBINARS, SOCIAL MEDIA, NEWSLETTERS, POPULAR PRESS, AND OTHER MEDIUMS AS OPPORTUNITIES ARISE TO ENSURE THAT THEY REACH DIVERSE STAKEHOLDER GROUPS. IN ADDITION, A PEERREVIEWED SCIENTIFIC PUBLICATION WILL BE PRODUCED THAT WILL DOCUMENT IN DETAIL RESEARCH FINDINGS AND PROVIDE INTERPRETATION IN CONTEXT OF WILD TURKEY CONSERVATION.

AWARD PURPOSE  THE PURPOSE OF THIS APPLIED RESEARCH PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT THE LONG TERM RETENTION OF WOMEN IN HUNTING, FISHING, AND THE OUTDOORS, MORE GENERALLY. WOMEN ARE MAKING SIGNIFICANT IN ROADS IN THESE HISTORICALLY MALE DOMINATED SPORTS. AS A RESULT, WOMEN ARE INCREASINGLY RECOGNIZED AS A KEY DEMOGRAPHIC TO SUPPORT THE AMERICAN HUNTING AND FISHING HERITAGE. EVEN WITH SUCCESSFUL RECRUITMENT, MANAGERS HAVE IDENTIFIED PROBLEMS WITH RETENTION BECAUSE EVEN AFTER INITIAL TRAINING, WOMEN NEED MORE MENTORSHIP AND SUPPORT TO DO OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES ON THEIR OWN.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  WE WILL CONDUCT A PROGRAM EVALUATION, CREATE AN INTERACTIVE TOOL, ESTABLISH A COMMUNITY OF PRACTICE, AND SHARE OUR FINDINGS ACROSS A DIVERSE AUDIENCE TO ENHANCE MENTORSHIP OPPORTUNITIES AND INCREASE RETENTION. WE WILL USE FOCUS GROUPS AND INTERVIEWS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE TYPES OF PROGRAMS ARE BEST FOR INCREASING WOMEN S RETENTION IN HUNTING AND FISHING SPORTS. AN ONLINE, INTERACTIVE TOOL WILL DESCRIBE AND MAP THE WOMEN S HUNTING AND FISHING GROUPS SO WOMEN CAN MAKE CONNECTIONS TO GROUPS AND GROUPS CAN COLLABORATE WITH ONE ANOTHER. WE WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY OF PRACTICE FOR LEADERS OF WOMEN S HUNTING GROUPS TO SHARE LESSONS LEARNED, SOLVE CURRENT PROBLEMS AND PLAN FOR THE FUTURE. LAST, WE PLAN ON SHARING RESULTS WITH WOMEN S HUNTING AND FISHING GROUPS, STATE FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES, AND RESEARCHERS TO ENHANCE PROGRAMMING AND INCREASE WOMEN S RETENTION IN HUNTING AND FISHING.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES THE RESULTS OF THIS WORK WILL DIRECTLY INFORM R3 MENTORING PROGRAMS FOR WOMEN IN HUNTING AND FISHING ACROSS THE MOUNTAIN PRAIRIE REGION IN A FEW KEY WAYS. FIRST, THROUGH A DESCRIPTIVE, MIXED METHODS QUALITATIVE PROGRAM EVALUATION, THIS WORK WILL INFORM WOMEN S R3 MENTORING PROGRAMS BY IDENTIFYING WHICH FEATURES OF PROGRAMMING ARE MOST EFFECTIVE FOR THE LONG TERM RETENTION OF WOMEN IN HUNTING AND FISHING. THIS ACTIONABLE INFORMATION WILL BE SHARED DIRECTLY WITH PROGRAM LEADERS WHO CAN ADJUST VARIOUS ASPECTS OF THEIR PROGRAMMING TO ENSURE THEY ARE MEETING THE NEEDS OF PARTICIPANTS AND SUPPORT THEM BEYOND INITIAL RECRUITMENT. SECOND, THE RESULTS OF THIS WORK WILL SUPPORT WOMEN HUNTING AND FISHING PARTICIPANTS LOOKING FOR MORE OPPORTUNITIES FOR MENTORSHIP THROUGH THE CREATION OF AN ONLINE INTERACTIVE SOCIAL SYSTEMS MAP AND ACCOMPANYING STORYMAP. PARTICIPANTS WILL BE ABLE TO IDENTIFY PROGRAMS OF INTEREST AND IN PROXIMITY TO THEM, ENSURING THAT THEY CAN ACCESS CONTINUAL MENTORSHIP OPPORTUNITIES, THUS MAXIMIZING RETENTION OF NEWLY RECRUITED PARTICIPANTS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES  TAKEN TOGETHER, THIS WORK WILL BRING DIRECT BENEFIT TO WOMEN S HUNTING AND FISHING GROUPS AND PARTICIPANTS IN THE MOUNTAIN PRAIRIE REGION. ADDITIONALLY, THIS WORK BENEFITS WOMEN S HUNTING AND FISHING GROUPS AND FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES BEYOND THE REGION BECAUSE LESSONS LEARNED ARE APPLICABLE ACROSS THE COUNTRY. THIS FIRST TRIAL OF THE ONLINE INTERACTIVE MAPPING TOOL IN THE HUNTING AND FISHING CONTEXT WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE WIDER HUNTING AND FISHING MENTORING COMMUNITY AS THEY SEEK TO IMPROVE PROGRAM CONNECTIVITY TO MAXIMIZE RETENTION IN HUNTING AND FISHING OF HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  CURRENT COLLABORATORS INCLUDE  BECOMING AND OUTDOORS WOMAN (MT, SD, WY, AND UT), DEER CAMP (MT), CASTING FOR RECOVERY (NATIONAL), AND DIVA WOW (HEADQUARTERED IN TEXAS WITH MEMBERSHIP ACROSS THE REGION), THOUGH WE HAVE IDENTIFIED AND INITIATED CONTACT WITH OTHER POTENTIAL COLLABORATORS AND WILL CONTINUE TO SEEK COLLABORATION IN THE MONTHS LEADING UP TO THE GRANT.

AWARD PURPOSE  A KEY OBJECTIVE FOR THIS GRANT PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT AGENCIES, INDUSTRY, AND THE R3 COMMUNITY S BUSINESS AND RECRUITMENT EFFORTS WITH QUALITY, RELIABLE AND TIMELY RESEARCH INSIGHTS. THE MAIN PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE NEW DATA ON THREE ESSENTIAL R3 TOPICS THAT HAVE BEEN MEASURED IN SEPARATE STUDIES PREVIOUSLY. THE VALUE OF THIS PROJECT IS IN COMBINING THESE TOPICS INTO A SINGLE STUDY THAT WILL RESULT IN ACTIONABLE, CURRENT DATA ON ALL THREE TOPICS. NOT ONLY WILL THIS APPROACH ALLOW FOR SIGNIFICANT COST SAVINGS IN THE DATA COLLECTION, ANALYSIS, AND REPORTING, BUT IT WILL ALSO ENSURE MORE TIMELY DISSEMINATION OF THE FINDINGS AND THEIR IMPLICATIONS TO THE R3 COMMUNITY AND HUNTING AND SPORT SHOOTING INDUSTRY. THE OVERARCHING PROJECT PURPOSE IS TO PROVIDE R3 SPECIALISTS AND HUNTING AND SPORT SHOOTING PROGRAM MANAGERS WITH THE DATA THEY NEED TO EFFECTIVELY DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT PROGRAMS  THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH A NEW DATA COLLECTION EFFORT THAT EMPLOYS A HIGHLY RIGOROUS AND DEPENDABLE SURVEY METHODOLOGY APPROACH TO GUARANTEE ACCURATE, RELIABLE RESULTS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  REGARDING THE SPECIFIC ASPECTS OF THE PROPOSED RESEARCH PROJECT, THE PURPOSE IS THREEFOLD  1) ASSESS TRENDS IN AMERICANS  ATTITUDES TOWARD HUNTING, FISHING, SPORT SHOOTING, AND TRAPPING  2) IDENTIFY WAYS TO ENCOURAGE MORE SHOOTING PARTICIPATION AMONG THOSE IN FIREARM HOUSEHOLDS WHO ARE NOT CURRENTLY SHOOTING  AND 3) ASSESS HUNTERS  MOTIVATIONS FOR HUNTING AND THEIR USE OF VARIOUS TYPES OF FIREARMS FOR HUNTING, AS WELL AS HOW MOTIVATIONS AND SPECIFIC TYPES OF FIREARMS CORRELATE WITH CERTAIN DEMOGRAPHIC CHARACTERISTICS.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES  THIS PROJECT WILL UPDATE AND EXPAND THREE MAJOR STUDIES THAT PROVIDE CRITICAL DATA TO AGENCIES, INDUSTRY, AND THE R3 COMMUNITY. CRUCIALLY, THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ENSURE SIGNIFICANT COST SAVINGS BY CONDUCTING THE THREE STUDIES SIMULTANEOUSLY RATHER THAN AS THREE SEPARATE PROJECTS.FIRST, THE PROJECT TEAM WILL UPDATE THE LONGEST RUNNING AND MOST UTILIZED TREND STUDY REGARDING AMERICANS  ATTITUDES TOWARD HUNTING, FISHING, SPORT SHOOTING, AND TRAPPING. BEGINNING IN 1995, RESPONSIVE MANAGEMENT HAS SURVEYED AMERICANS TO DETERMINE THEIR ATTITUDES TOWARD THESE ACTIVITIES AND THEIR OPINIONS ON RELATED TOPICS.SECOND, THE TEAM WILL EXPAND RESEARCH FOCUSED ON REACTIVATION TO ASSIST WITH IDENTIFYING THE MOST EFFECTIVE WAYS TO ENCOURAGE SHOOTING PARTICIPATION AMONG MILLIONS OF INACTIVE FIREARM OWNERS, DIVERSE AND UNDERSERVED MARKETS, AND THOSE IN FIREARM HOUSEHOLDS WHO ARE NOT CURRENTLY SHOOTING. THIRD, THE TEAM WILL OBTAIN NEW DATA REGARDING HUNTERS  PARTICIPATION AND MOTIVATIONS, AS WELL AS THEIR USE OF VARIOUS FIREARM TYPES FOR DIFFERENT KINDS OF HUNTING.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES  R3 PROGRAM AND OUTDOOR INDUSTRY STAKEHOLDERS (INCLUDING BUSINESSES, AGENCIES, AND NGOS) WHO MUST CONTINUE TO TRACK AND UNDERSTAND AMERICANS  CURRENT ATTITUDES AND THE NEEDS OF CORE R3 GROUPS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  THE BULK OF THE PROJECT COST (83 ) IS FOR CONTRACTUAL SUPPORT FOR SURVEY DESIGN, FIELDING OF NATIONAL SURVEY, ANALYZING DATA AND DEVELOPING REPORTS.

AWARD PURPOSE  THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO FORM A TEAM OF APPROXIMATELY 24 MARKETING COMMUNICATION PROFESSIONALS FROM VARIOUS PARTS OF THE OUTDOOR INDUSTRY, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO  STATE AND FEDERAL WILDLIFE AGENCIES, NGOS CONSERVATION ORGANIZATIONS, TRADE ASSOCIATIONS, RETAILERS, MEDIA ORGANIZATIONS AND MANUFACTURERS. THE R3 MARKETING COMMUNICATION TASK FORCE (RMCTF) WILL USE EXISTING RESEARCH INSIGHTS TO DEVELOP AND COMMUNICATE MESSAGES ON TOPICS RELATED TO CONSERVATION FUNDING, RECRUITMENT AND WILDLIFE RESTORATION. THE R3 MARKETING COMMUNICATION TASK FORCE (RMCTF) WILL USE EXISTING RESEARCH INSIGHTS TO DEVELOP AND COMMUNICATE MESSAGES ON TOPICS SUCH AS   HOW CONSERVATION IS FUNDED.  HOW TO RECRUIT THE NEXT GENERATION OF HUNTERS AND TARGET SHOOTERS.  ACCESS IN AMERICA, 950 MILLION ACRES AND COUNTING.  WHERE TO GO TARGET SHOOTING.  HOW AND WHY WILDLIFE IS THRIVING.  THE BENEFITS OF HUNTING.  HOW TO GET STARTED HUNTING OR TARGET SHOOTING.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  OBJECTIVE 1  RECRUIT 24 TASK FORCE TEAM MEMBERS. POTENTIAL MEMBERS MUST COMMIT TO COMMUNICATING MESSAGES CREATED BY THE TASK FORCE. OBJECTIVE 2  DEVELOP AND COMMUNICATE A MINIMUM OF 12 MESSAGES. MEMBERS OF THE R3 MARKETING COMMUNICATION TASK FORCE (RMCTF) WILL VIRTUALLY MEET AND DISCUSS POTENTIAL TOPICS TO CONSIDER FOR PROMOTION. ONCE TOPICS ARE SELECTED, THE RMCTF WILL DEVELOP PROMOTIONAL MATERIALS SUCH AS CO BRANDED PRESS RELEASES OR INFOGRAPHICS. SUSTAINABLE AND EFFECTIVE CONSERVATION MANAGEMENT OF OUR WILDLIFE AND NATURAL RESOURCES RELIES ONTHE CREATIVITY AND INNOVATION OF FISH AND WILDLIFE STAFF IN FEDERAL, STATE, NON PROFIT, TRIBAL, ANDINDUSTRY ORGANIZATIONS. THESE STAFF MUST BE EQUIPPED TO DEAL WITH THE INTRICATE AND COMPLEXPROBLEMS THAT CONSERVATION ORGANIZATIONS FACE EVERY DAY. HOWEVER, HIGH RETIREMENT RATES ANDSTRUGGLES WITH RECRUITMENT WITHIN THESE AGENCIES CONTINUES TO IMPACT AND PUT CONSERVATION GAINS ATRISK. DATA REVEAL THE TENURE OF A STATE DIRECTOR IS AN AVERAGE OF THREE YEARS. THIS STAGGERING LOSSOF LEADERSHIP, COUPLED WITH THE CHALLENGES FACING STATE AGENCIES TO REMAIN RELEVANT, ADAPT TOCHANGING LANDSCAPES AND CONSTITUENCIES, AND SECURE STABLE SOURCES OF FUNDING, REQUIRES CONSISTENTLEADERSHIP AT ALL LEVELS WITHIN AN AGENCY. EMPOWERING AGENCY STAFF WITH THE SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, ANDEFFICACY TO MANAGE PROJECTS WITH DIVERSE STAKEHOLDERS, ACROSS GEOGRAPHIC RANGES, AND WITHIN THEIROWN AGENCIES IS ESSENTIAL TO WELL MANAGED AND THRIVING ORGANIZATION.OFFERING LEADERSHIP PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR STAFF AT ALL LEVELS WITHIN CONSERVATION AGENCIESAND ORGANIZATIONS IS CRITICAL TO MOVING THE NEEDLE ON THESE COMPLEX ISSUES. THE MANAGEMENTASSISTANCE TEAM AND THE NATIONAL CONSERVATION LEADERSHIP INSTITUTE OFFER A MULTITUDE OF COURSES ANDTRAININGS   VIRTUALLY AND IN PERSON   TO MEET THOSE NEEDS. FROM ONLINE SYNCHRONOUS COURSES,MULTI DAY WEBINARS, AND ASYNCHRONOUS OPTIONS TO LONG TERM, IN DEPTH, AND COMPREHENSIVE LEADERSHIPTRAINING, THE MAT AND NCLI CONTRACT WITH TOP NOTCH PROFESSIONALS TO DELIVER HIGH QUALITY TRAINING.WE VE REACHED THOUSANDS OF STATE AGENCY PERSONNEL, EMPOWERING THEM TO MAKE LASTING CHANGES WITHIN THEIR ORGANIZATIONS.

AWARD PURPOSE  THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO BRING AWARENESS TO DIVERSITY OPPORTUNITIES IN HUNTING AND TARGET SHOOTING. PARTICIPATION BY MINORITIES IN HUNTING AND TARGET SHOOTING IS DISPROPORTIONATELY LOW COMPARED TO THE PERCENTAGE OF MINORITIES THAT MAKE UP THE US POPULATION. SOME PROGRESS HAS BEEN MADE WITH INDIVIDUAL EFFORTS AND PROGRAMS BUT, UNTIL THIS POINT, THERE HAS NOT BEEN A CONCERTED EFFORT TO COMBINE INDUSTRY AND AGENCY RESOURCES AND SHOWCASE DIVERSITY IN THE OUTDOORS BY RECRUITING FROM WITHIN. THIS GRANT WILL WORK WITH NONTYPICAL OUTDOORSMAN TELEVISION SHOW, WHICH IS ONE OF THE ONLY OUTDOOR TELEVISION SHOWS HOSTED AND PRODUCED BY AN AFRICAN AMERICAN. THE GRANT TEAM WILL WORK WITH STATE AGENCIES AND THE FIREARMS INDUSTRY TO RECRUIT PARTICIPANTS TO FEATURE ON SIX DIFFERENT EPISODES (30 45 MINUTES EACH) OF THE TV SHOW. WE WILL LOOK TO RECRUIT STAFF NEW TO HUNTING AND OR TARGET SHOOTING THAT COME FROM DIVERSE BACKGROUNDS. THE SHOWS WILL AIR ON PLACES SUCH AS THE PURSUIT CHANNEL AND YOUTUBE. THE FULL SHOWS, ALONG WITH SHORTENED VIDEO CLIPS (2 3 MINUTES EACH), WILL BE PROVIDED TO AGENCY AND INDUSTRY PARTNERS FOR EXPANDED PROMOTION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS FAR REACHING PROJECT WILL START IMMEDIATELY UPON RECEIPT OF FUNDING AND WILL BE FAST MOVING AS THERE HAS BEEN HIGH INTEREST BY SOME PARTNERS TO PARTICIPATE IN SUCH AN OPPORTUNITY. WE WILL FOCUS ON INVITING GUESTS FROM A MIX OF AGENCIES AND INDUSTRY THAT ARE BOTH NEW TO HUNTING SHOOTING AND COME FROM DIVERSE BACKGROUNDS. INVITATIONS WILL GO OUT THROUGH PLACES LIKE THE AFWA DIRECTORS WIRE AND AT IN PERSON AT CONFERENCES SUCH AS SHOT SHOW (JANUARY 2023) AND WMI NORTH AMERICAN (MARCH 2023).THE GRANT TEAM HAS EXTENSIVE CONTACTS AT AGENCIES AND INDUSTRY AND WILL UTILIZE THEM TO RECRUIT PARTICIPANTS. TELEVISION EPISODES CREATED FOR THIS PROJECT WILL BE PROMOTED IN PLACES SUCH AS THE PURSUIT CHANNEL AND YOUTUBE. ADDITIONALLY, NONTYPICAL OUTDOORSMAN TV AND OSCF WILL SHARE FULL LENGTH EPISODES AS WELL AS SHORTENED VIDEO CLIPS TO PARTICIPATING AGENCY AND INDUSTRY PARTNERS SO THAT THEY MAY PROMOTE THEIR EFFORTS TO THEIR CUSTOMER FILES TO EXPAND THE REACH. CLIPS WILL ALSO BE PROMOTED ON SOCIAL MEDIA CHANNELS. OUTREACH WILL ALSO INCLUDE WRITTEN ARTICLES AND LIVE PRESENTATIONS AT AGENCY AND INDUSTRY CONFERENCES SUCH AS  AFWA AND REGIONAL AFWA CONFERENCES, WMI NORTH AMERICAN, ATA, SHOT SHOW, IHEA USA AND ACI CONFERENCES.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES  THE PRIMARY RESULT OF THIS GRANT PROJECT WILL BE SIX FULL LENGTH (30   45 MINUTE) EPISODES OF NONTYPICAL OUTDOORSMAN TV SHOW. AN ADDITIONAL PRODUCT WILL BE SIX SHORTENED CLIPS (2 3 MINUTES) THAT HIGHLIGHT EACH SHOW. THE FULL SHOWS AND CLIPS WILL BE SHARED WITH AGENCY AND INDUSTRY PARTNERS FOR USE AS THEY SEE FIT. THE PRIMARY BENEFIT OF THIS GRANT IS THE ABILITY TO SHOWCASE AGENCIES AND INDUSTRY WORKING TOGETHER AND TAKE THE LEAD ON DIVERSITY RECRUITMENT.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES  BLACK, INDIGENOUS AND PEOPLE OF COLOR.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  PRODUCTION OF SIX FULL LENGTH (30   45 MINUTE) EPISODES OF NONTYPICAL OUTDOORSMAN TV SHOW.

AWARD PURPOSE  EVEN THOUGH NATIVE AMERICANS WERE AMERICAS ORIGINAL FISHERMEN AND CONSERVATIONISTS, WE DO NOT KNOW MUCH ABOUT THEIR CURRENT PARTICIPATION RATES IN FISHING OR THEIR CULTURAL TRENDS PERTAINING TO FISHING. THERE ARE NEARLY 600 FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED NATIVE AMERICAN TRIBES WITH APPROXIMATELY SEVEN MILLION MEMBERS LIVING ACROSS THE UNITED STATES TODAY. THIS GRANT PROJECT IS NEEDED TO BETTER UNDERSTAND NATIVE AMERICANS CURRENT BARRIERS TO ENTRY, ACCESS TO LANDS AND WATERS (BOTH ON AND OFF RESERVATION PROPERTIES), AS WELL AS WHAT THEIR THOUGHTS ARE ON CURRENT LAWS, REGULATIONS, LICENSING AND WHAT THEIR PERCEPTIONS ARE OF INDUSTRY AND STATE AND FEDERAL WILDLIFE AGENCIES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  A STRONG NEED EXISTS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND NATIVE AMERICANS CURRENT PARTICIPATION AND FUTURE INTEREST IN FISHING. THIS PROJECT ALIGNS NICELY WITH THE STRATEGIC PRIORITY OF R3 AND ENGAGING NEW AUDIENCES. PROJECT TASKS INCLUDE SURVEY QUESTIONNAIRE DEVELOPMENT, DEPLOYMENT, ANALYSIS, REPORTING AND COMMUNICATING PRESENTING RESULTS.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES  WE WILL DEVELOP AND PROMOTE A FINAL REPORT THAT WILL COVER THE RESULTS FROM BOTH THE FISHING AND THE HUNTING PROJECTS (F22AP00611) MAKING IT EASIER FOR INDUSTRY AND AGENCY STAFF TO GET A COMPLETE PICTURE OF NATIVE AMERICANS OUTDOOR PARTICIPATION. WE EXPECT THE USEFUL SHELF LIFE OF THE INSIGHTS FROM THIS STUDY TO BE FIVE  YEARS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES 600 FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED NATIVE AMERICAN TRIBES WITH APPROXIMATELY SEVEN MILLION MEMBERS LIVING ACROSS THE UNITED STATES TODAY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  APPROXIMATELY 56  OF THE BUDGET FOR THIS PROJECT IS ALLOCATED TO DYNATA CONTRACTUAL SUPPORT FOR SURVEY DEPLOYMENT, PROMOTION AND SAMPLE COSTS TO OBTAIN AS MANY RESPONSES AS POSSIBLE.

AWARD PURPOSE  THE NORTH AMERICAN MODEL OF WILDLIFE CONSERVATION PROVIDES OPPORTUNITY FOR ALL AND ENSURES THE RIGHT OF LEGAL ACCESS TO HUNTING AND FISHING OPPORTUNITIES FOR EVERY CITIZEN. IN TURN, THE MILLIONS OF AMERICANS THAT TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE OPPORTUNITY TO HUNT AND FISH PROVIDE SUBSTANTIAL FINANCIAL SUPPORT OF THE NA MODEL. PURCHASES OF HUNTING AND FISHING LICENSES COUPLED WITH PURCHASES OF EXCISE TAXED PRODUCTS PROVIDE APPROXIMATELY  3 BILLION TO SUPPORT THIS MODEL ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. RESEARCH HAS SHOWN THAT MOST AMERICANS ARE UNAWARE OF THE TENANTS OF THE NA MODEL AND DO NOT FULLY UNDERSTAND HOW OUR NATURAL RESOURCES ARE MANAGED, CONSERVED OR FUNDED.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED   OBJECTIVE  THIS PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON STRATEGIC PRIORITY (4B)  TRUST FUND STEWARDSHIP, EDUCATION AND PROMOTION OF THE NA MODEL. AS SUCH, A PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP AND PROMOTE A MINIMUM OF 25 MESSAGES THAT SIMPLIFY AND EXPLAIN THE SEVEN TENANTS OF THE NA MODEL, AS WELL AS, HOW OUR NATURAL RESOURCES AND MANAGED, CONSERVED AND FUNDED.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES   IMPACT  RESEARCH SHOWS THAT THERE ARE AN ESTIMATED 60 MILLION AMERICANS THAT ACTIVELY PARTICIPATE IN HUNTING, FISHING AND OR TARGET SHOOTING. COMMUNICATIONS, INCLUDING VIDEOS AND GRAPHICS, DEVELOPED FOR CONNECTING WITH CONSERVATION WILL BE PROVIDED TO INDUSTRY AND AGENCY FOR DISTRIBUTION TO THEIR MILLIONS OF CUSTOMERS. GRANT PARTNERS WILL SHARE AND PROMOTED MESSAGES AND WE WILL WORK WITH MEDIA GROUPS SUCH AS PROFESSIONAL OUTDOOR MEDIA ASSOC., ASSOCIATION FOR CONSERVATION INFORMATION AND OUTDOOR SPORTSMENS GROUP TO DISTRIBUTE THE MESSAGES TO A FAR REACHING AUDIENCE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES  THE ANTICIPATED LIFE OF DELIVERABLES FROM THIS PROJECT EXCEEDS TEN YEARS. COMMUNICATIONS DEVELOPED FROM THIS PROJECT, INCLUDING GRAPHICS AND VIDEOS, WILL HAVE A TIMELESS MESSAGE THAT IS EVERGREEN AND WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR INDUSTRY, AGENCY AND CONSUMERS TO USE, SHARE AND PROMOTE THE SUCCESSES OF THE NA MODEL AND CONSERVATION FUNDING FOR MANY YEARS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  THE BULK OF THIS PROJECTS COST ( 75 ) IS FOR CONTRACTUAL CREATIVE ADVERTISING SUPPORT. THE GRANT TEAM WILL CONTRACT AN AD AGENCY TO SUPPORT DEVELOPMENT AND DISTRIBUTION OF COMMUNICATION MATERIALS. TO MAKE THIS PROJECT EXTREMELY COST EFFECTIVE, WE WILL UTILIZE INDUSTRY AND AGENCY PARTNERS EXISTING RESOURCES SUCH AS NEWSLETTERS, WEBSITES AND SOCIAL MEDIA CHANNELS TO PROMOTE CREATED CONTENT TO MORE THAN FIVE MILLION NEW AND ACTIVE PARTICIPANTS.

THE BENEFITS AND THE WORK THAT WILDLIFE AGENCIES CONDUCT USING THOSE FUNDS ARE NOT WIDELY KNOWN BY EXCISE TAX PAYING MANUFACTURERS AND EVEN LESS KNOWN BY OUTDOORSMEN AND WOMEN AND THE GENERAL POPULATION. THE NEED TO PARTNER FEDERAL AND STATE AGENCIES WITH INDUSTRY TO WORK TOGETHER IN COMMUNICATING THIS IMPRESSIVE SYSTEM AND THE SUCCESS STORIES STEMMING FROM THE USE OF EXCISE TAXES WITHIN THEINDUSTRY, AS WELL AS, TO A BROADER AUDIENCE IS IMPERATIVE TO KEEPING THIS SYSTEM IN PLACE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  OBJECTIVE 1   COORDINATE AND PARTICIPATE IN OR SPONSOR 8 EVENTS BY 9 30 2023. CONDUCT EIGHT (8) FIELD OR FACILITIES TOURS TO ENGAGE STATE, FEDERAL AGENCY STAFF AND INDUSTRY LEADERS AND COMMUNICATION STAFF. OBJECTIVE 2   DEVELOP SIX (6) VIDEOS THAT HIGHLIGHT THE BENEFITS OF EXCISE TAXES BY 9 30 2023.THE SIX (6) VIDEOS WILL HIGHLIGHT THE BENEFITS OF MANUFACTURES EXCISE TAXES ON THE CONSERVATION ACHIEVEMENTS AND PUBLIC ACCESS (HUNTING   TARGET SHOOTING) OPPORTUNITIES, EDUCATION PROGRAMS AND PARTNERSHIPS THAT EXIST. OBJECTIVE 3   RELEVANCY AND  INCLUSION AND  PARTICIPATION. A COMMUNICATIONS FIRM WILL BE CONTRACTED TO VIDEO DOCUMENT AND PROMOTE A MINIMUM OF SIX PARTNER WITH A PAYER EVENTS ACROSS MULTIPLE REGIONS. PROMOTIONAL MATERIALS WILL BE DISTRIBUTED TO ALL PARTIES AND COMMUNICATED TO A VAST AUDIENCE USING A VARIETY OF MEDIUMS INCLUDING SOCIAL, WEB, EMAIL, PRINT, AND LIVE PRESENTATIONS.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES  A COMMUNICATIONS FIRM WILL BE CONTRACTED TO VIDEO DOCUMENT AND PROMOTE A MINIMUM OF SIX PARTNER WITH A PAYER EVENTS ACROSS MULTIPLE REGIONS. PROMOTIONAL MATERIALS WILL BE DISTRIBUTED TO ALL PARTIES AND COMMUNICATED TO A VAST AUDIENCE USING A VARIETY OF MEDIUMS INCLUDING SOCIAL, WEB, EMAIL, PRINT, AND LIVE PRESENTATIONS. AWARD PURPOSE  THIS PROJECT WILL HELP STATE WILDLIFE AGENCIES BETTER UNDERSTAND THE OPPORTUNITIES TO BUILD ADDITIONAL PUBLIC SHOOTING RANGES USING EXCISE TAX FUNDS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  THIS PROJECT WILL ORGANIZE AND PROVIDE CRITICAL RANGE DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE RESOURCES AND SERVICES THROUGH ONE COMPREHENSIVE, COOPERATIVE EFFORT BETWEEN STATES AND INDUSTRY. THE RESULTS WILL HELP STATES DEVELOP NEW RANGE CAPACITY IN AREAS OF GREATEST DEMAND, TAP INTO FINANCIAL AND RANGE DESIGN EXPERTISE AND RESOURCES, AND SUPPORT TARGET SHOOTING PARTICIPATION TO HIGHER LEVELS WHICH IN TURNS PROVIDES GREATER RESOURCES FOR WILDLIFE AND HABITAT CONSERVATION.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES  1. DEMONSTRATE HOW STATES CAN IDENTIFY AREAS WHERE TARGET SHOOTING DEMAND IS UNDER SERVED.2. EFFECTIVELY TRANSFER ALL FINDINGS TO STATES.3. ENGAGE WITH AT LEAST FIVE (5) STATES TO IDENTIFY QUESTIONS AND TOPICS NECESSARY FOR INCLUSION.4. HELP STATES MAKE THE CASE FOR EXPANDED TARGET SHOOTING OPPORTUNITIES.5. INCREASE UNDERSTANDING OF THE NEW TARGET PRACTICE AND MARKSMANSHIP TRAINING SUPPORT ACT.6. PROVIDE CASE STUDIES THAT IDENTIFY AND EXPLAIN PARTNERING AND FINANCIAL RESOURCES STATES CAN ACCESS TOINCREASE SHOOTING OPPORTUNITIES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES PARTICIPATION IN TARGET SHOOTING HAS INCREASED 65 PERCENT, FROM 34 MILLION IN 2009 TO 56 MILLION PARTICIPANTS IN 2020 (NSSF). YOUTH ORGANIZATIONS ARE REPORTING RECORD PARTICIPATION IN SHOOTING SPORTS. THE RECENT SURGE IN PARTICIPATION AND FIREARM SALES HAS LEFT MANY FIRST TIME OWNERS WITH NOWHERE TO SHOOT. THESE ISSUES HAVE LED TO MANY PEOPLE BEING TURNED AWAY FROM RANGES WHILE OTHERS DON T HAVE CONVENIENT RANGE OPTIONS. BY COMBINING STATES AND INDUSTRY EXPERIENCE INTO ONE COMPREHENSIVE AND COOPERATIVE EFFORT, STATES CAN BETTER EXPAND PUBLIC TARGET SHOOTING OPPORTUNITIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  CONTRACTOR, SOUTHWICK ASSOCIATES WILL ASSIST WITH THE STATES SURVEY PLUS WILL CONDUCT THE GIS DEMAND ASSESSMENT BASED ON THEIR PREVIOUS EFFORTS THAT PIONEERED LOCATING SHOOTING DEMAND.

FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES AND OTHER ASSOCIATION OF FISH AND WILDLIFE (AFWA) MEMBERS NEED TO COLLABORATE, SHARE KNOWLEDGE, AND DEVELOPCAPACITY AS IT RELATES TO SHARED PRIORITIES. AS PART OF THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE AFWA STRATEGICPLAN, AFWA MEMBERS EXPRESSED THE VALUE OF AFWA BEING THE  CONVENER  OF  PLAYBOOKS  AND  BESTPRACTICES  TO AID ALL MEMBERS IN COLLABORATING MORE EFFECTIVELY AND SHARING KNOWLEDGE AND LESSONSLEARNED AND BEST PRACTICES. THIS PROJECT PROPOSES TO IMPLEMENT THAT VISION AND TO CREATE AN  AFWAKNOWLEDGE HUB  THAT WILL PROVIDE AN ENHANCED COMMUNICATION PLATFORM FOR ALL GOALS IN THE AFWASTRATEGIC PLAN, INCLUDING SCIENCE, DEI, AND R3 AND WILL BE DEVELOPED IN SUCH A MANNER TO SUPPORTEXPANSION AS NEEDS EMERGE IN OUT YEARS. THROUGH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS PROJECT, AFWA WILL HELPTO BUILD CAPACITY WITH ALL MEMBERS AND SUPPORT AFWA IN DELIVERING ON ITS STRATEGIC PLAN.AFWA HAS DEVELOPED AN INITIAL CONCEPT, INCLUDING REQUIREMENTS AND DESIGNS, FOR THE WEB BASED  AFWAKNOWLEDGE HUB.  THIS CONCEPT WILL ALLOW ALL FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES TO ACCESS A WEB INTERFACEEMBEDDED WITH  PLAYBOOKS  THAT ARE CASE STUDIES AND BEST PRACTICES THAT CAN BE SHARED AMONGAGENCIES. THE PROPOSED SOLUTION WILL HAVE CAPABILITIES THAT PRIORITIZE INTUITIVE DATA SHARING,ORGANIZATION OF DATA, SEAMLESS COLLABORATION, AND A CLEAN DESIGN FOR NON TECHNICAL USERS.ADDITIONALLY, THE CONTENT ON THE HUB WILL BE EASY TO UPDATE AND REQUIRE NO CODE DEPLOYMENTS ORDEDICATED TECHNICAL STAFF.IT IS ENVISIONED THAT EACH  PLAYBOOK  WILL BE CONSTRUCTED IN A SIMILAR MANNER TO AID IN ADOPTION BYOTHER MEMBERS. THE PROJECT TEAM WILL CREATE A SIMPLE AND DIGESTIBLE TEMPLATE THAT WILL INCLUDE THEWHY, WHAT, WHO, HOW, WHEN, HOW MUCH, AND OUTCOMES FOR EACH CASE STUDY   BEST PRACTICE PLAYBOOK. WEALSO ENVISION THE  HUB  LINKING OUT TO FULL DOCUMENTS FOR EACH STATE OR REGION WHERE APPLICABLE(E.G., R3 PLANS, REGIONAL LANDSCAPE SCAPE IMPLEMENTATION CUMENTS, ETC.).

STATE FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES ARE CHARGED WITH MANAGING WILDLIFE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC. NUMEROUS FEDERAL AGENCIES SHARE MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITY ACROSS STATE BOUNDARIES. NONPROFIT ORGANZIATIONS (NGO S) DEDICATED TO CONSERVING SPECIFIC SPECIES AND LANDSCAPES ACT ON A REGIONAL AND NATIONAL LEVEL IN COOPERATION AND COORDINATION WITH STATE AND FEDERAL AGENCIES. IT IS ONLY POSSIBLE TO RECOGNIZE THE FULL BENEFIT OF THESE VARIED EFFORTS BY ENGAGING IN REGIONAL AND NATIONAL LEVEL COORDINATION. COORDINATING SUCCESSFUL CONSERVATION EFFORTS AMONG ALL INVOLVED PARTIES ACROSS NORTH AMERICA REQUIRES THE RESOURCES TO BRING STATE AGENCY LEADERS TO THE TABLE. MANY STATE AGENCIES COULD NOT PARTICIPATE IN THESE EFFORTS WITHOUT EXTERNAL FUNDING SUPPORT. THIS FUNDING IS NECESSARY FOR DEDICATED RESOURCES TO FOSTER, MAINTAIN, AND GROW RELATIONS BETWEEN STATE AGENCIES AND INDUSTRY. THE LATTER IS RESPONSIBLE FOR EXCISE TAX CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE PITTMAN ROBERTSON RESTORATION ACT AND THE DINGELL JOHNSON SPORT FISH RESTORATION ACT, WHICH ARE SIGNIFICANT CONTRIBUTORS. WHEN STATE AGENCIES AND INDUSTRIES ARE NOT ACTIVELY MEETING AND COORDINATING, THERE IS A HIGH RISK OF MISUNDERSTANDING AND DYSFUNCTIONS  CENTRALIZED COMMUNICATIONS TO ALL THESE PARTIES ARE HIGHLY VALUED TO ENSURE THAT RELEVANT ISSUES ARE BROUGHT TO LIGHT.FURTHERMORE, STATE FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES AND THEIR PARTNERS CAN DEBATE AND DISCUSS THE BEST SOLUTIONS TO CROSS JURISDICTIONAL, NATIONAL, AND NATIONAL, REGIONAL WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT ISSUES. THE PROPOSAL WILL FOCUS ON THREE PRIORITIES PARTICIPATION IN REGIONAL AND NATIONAL FORUMS WHERE PLANNING AND COORDINATION ARE PERFORMED WITH FEDERAL, NGO, AND INDUSTRY PARTNERS. SUPPORT IS INCLUDED FOR STATE AGENCY DIRECTORS AND SENIOR ASSOCIATION STAFF FOR EXPENSES RELATED TO ATTENDING MEETINGS EITHER REMOTELY (REGISTRATIONS) AND OR IN PERSON PARTICIPATION (REGISTRATION AND TRAVEL EXPENSES) TO MEETINGS OF REGIONAL AND NATIONAL SIGNIFICANCE, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO  REGIONAL ASSOCIATION MEETINGS  THE NORTH AMERICAN  THE ASSOCIATION OF FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES (AFWA) ANNUAL MEETING  NGOS MEETINGS  INDUSTRY MEETINGS AND OTHER EVENTS AND MEETINGS. STATE DIRECTORS AND ASSOCIATION STAFF WILL ATTEND MAJOR INDUSTRY EVENTS TO MAINTAIN OPEN COMMUNICATIONS AND TO COORDINATE ON IMPORTANT AND OFTEN SENSITIVE ISSUES THAT CAN DETERMINE THE SUCCESS OR FAILURE OF CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT INITIATIVES IMPORTANT TO THE ASSOCIATION S MEMBERS.STRATEGIC COMMUNICATIONS. AFWA WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR IMPLEMENTING A COMMUNICATIONS PLAN AND MAINTAINING A COMMUNICATIONS INFRASTRUCTURE THAT ALLOWS STATE FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES TO COORDINATE WITH EACH OTHER EFFECTIVELY AND THEIR NGO AND FEDERAL PARTNERS ON REGIONAL AND NATIONAL IMPORTANCE ISSUES. FUNDING FOR 2  SPRINT CHALLENGES,  AN AWARD WINNING APPROACH TO DECISION MAKING DEVELOPED BY JAKE KNAPP THAT FOCUSES ON DEVELOPING SOLUTIONS TO EMERGING CHALLENGES QUICKLY AND COST EFFECTIVELY.

DECISIONS MADE IN INTERNATIONAL FORA, SUCH AS THE CONVENTIONON THE INTERNATIONAL TRADE IN ENDANGERED SPECIES OF WILD FLORA AND FAUNA (CITES), CAN POSITIVELYAND NEGATIVELY AFFECT THE MANAGEMENT AUTHORITY OR PRACTICES OF STATE, PROVINCIAL, AND TERRITORIALFISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES. HOWEVER, IT IS NOT REALISTIC NOR ECONOMICALLY VIABLE FOR ALL STATE FISHAND WILDLIFE AGENCIES (STATES) TO PARTICIPATE IN CITES, THE INTERNATIONAL UNION FOR CONSERVATION OFNATURE (IUCN), OR OTHER INTERNATIONAL FORA. AT THE SAME TIME, U.S. FEDERAL AGENCIES, FOREIGNGOVERNMENTS, AND NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS (NGOS) ARE AT THE TABLE AND HAVE INPUT IN DECISIONS. THEREFORE IN 1994, THE CITESTECHNICAL WORK GROUP (WORK GROUP) WAS CREATED. IT INCLUDES A MEMBER FROM EACH STATE REGIONALASSOCIATION AND THE ASSOCIATION OF FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES (AFWA). THE WORK GROUP HAS BEEN HIGHLY EFFECTIVE IN SUPPORTING THE STATE S (AND WHEREAPPROPRIATE CANADIAN PROVINCES AND TERRITORIES) ABILITY TO MANAGE AND CONSERVE WILDLIFE, AND ININFLUENCING DECISIONS THROUGH SCIENCE BASED POSITIONS THAT ENCOURAGE THE SUSTAINABLE USE OFWILDLIFE. IN THE ABSENCE OF THE WORK GROUP, THE STATES DO NOT HAVE A VOICE IN DECISIONS NOR CANTHEY BRING SCIENCE BASED, ON THE GROUND EXPERTISE TO HELP GUIDE DECISIONS. CONSIDERING THE CURRENTPANDEMIC AND THE SPOTLIGHT IT HAS PUT ON FISH AND WILDLIFE USE AND CONSUMPTION, HAVING A VOICE ININTERNATIONAL FORA IS EVEN MORE CRITICAL.THE GOAL OF THE WORK GROUP IS TO ENSURE THAT POSITIONS ARE PRESENTED IN INTERNATIONAL FORA THATSUPPORT SUSTAINABLE USE AND THE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT OF NATIVE SPECIES, UTILIZE THE BESTAVAILABLE SCIENCE, AND SUPPORT STATE MANAGEMENT AUTHORITY  AND THAT THE STATES AND THE U.S.GOVERNMENT COLLABORATE ON INTERNATIONAL CONSERVATION ISSUES. ADDITIONALLY, THE WORK GROUPCOORDINATES WITH THE U.S. FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE (USFWS) TO ENSURE THAT PROCESSES FOR THEIMPLEMENTATION OF TREATY DECISIONS ARE PRACTICAL TO IMPLEMENT BY THE STATES. TO ACCOMPLISH THIS,THE WORK GROUP MUST PARTICIPATE IN CITES AND IUCN MEETINGS AND WORK CLOSELY WITH THE USFWS ANDOTHER FEDERAL AGENCIES. THIS GRANT WILL ALLOW THE WORK GROUP TO ENSURE THAT THE STATE S ABILITY TOMANAGE WILDLIFE IS NOT INFRINGED UPON BY ACTIONS TAKEN AT CITES, IUCN OR OTHER FORA, AND WHEREAPPROPRIATE, THE WORK GROUP WILL SUPPORT CANADIAN PROVINCES AND TERRITORIES. THE WORK GROUP WILLALSO SERVE AS THE STATE FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES CONTACT POINT WITH THE USFWS AND OTHER FEDERALAGENCIES, PROVIDING AN EFFICIENT WAY FOR THE U.S. GOVERNMENT TO COOPERATIVELY IMPLEMENT THEIRINTERNATIONAL OBLIGATIONS. THE IMPACT OF GRANT OUTCOMES CONTINUES BEYOND THE LIFE OF THIS GRANT BY IMPACTING FISH AND WILDLIFE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT.

SUCCESSFUL ANNUAL CYCLE CONSERVATION OF WATERFOWLLED STATES TO CREATE COMPLEMENTARY EFFORTS FOR PRIORITY SPECIES OF GREATEST CONSERVATION NEED(SGCN) THROUGH A PROGRAM CALLED SOUTHERN WINGS. SOUTHERN WINGS HELPS FOCUS VITAL CONSERVATION FUNDSON TARGETED SITES ALONG MIGRATORY PATHWAYS AND ON WINTERING GROUNDS FOR MORE THAN ONE HALF OF NORTHAMERICA S BREEDING BIRDS. THE GOAL OF OUR PROPOSAL IS TO HELP SOUTHERN WINGS AND THE STATES BE MOREEFFICIENT AND IMPACTFUL WITH THEIR FINITE RESOURCES BY CREATING AND PROVIDING EASY ACCESS TOCONSERVATION PLANNING RESOURCES. THIS GOAL WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY REFINING, IMPROVING, ANDSUMMARIZING INFORMATION THAT IS AVAILABLE THROUGH THE MIGRATORY CONNECTIVITY PROJECT, BIRDMIGRATION EXPLORER, AND EBIRD STATUS AND TRENDS. SPECIFICALLY, WE WILL  1) CONDUCT WORKSHOPS WITHTHE STATES TO EXPLICITLY DEFINE THE TYPE AND PRESENTATION MODE OF FULL ANNUAL CYCLE INFORMATIONNEEDED BY THE STATES AND A POST PROJECT SURVEY TO EVALUATE IMPACT OF THE PROPOSED WORK, AND 2)ASSEMBLE AN ONLINE STATE SPECIFIC GUIDE TO ANNUAL CYCLE CONSERVATION OF PRIORITY BIRD SPECIES THATWILL ALLOW STATES TO IDENTIFY WHERE THE SPECIES IN THEIR STATE REGION SPEND OTHER PARTS OF THEANNUAL CYCLE. THIS  SOUTHERN WINGS GUIDE  (HEREAFTER GUIDE) WILL ALLOW STATES TO ACCESS MULTIPLE,NOVEL AND COMPLEMENTARY SOURCES OF INFORMATION THAT CAN GUIDE TARGETED INVESTMENT OF FUNDS TOSUCCESSFULLY IMPLEMENT STATE WILDLIFE ACTION PLAN (SWAP) OBJECTIVES FOR SGCNS. IT WILL ALSO HELPSTATES DEVELOP PARTNERSHIPS WITH ORGANIZATIONS WORKING IN THE PLACES THEIR BIRDS USE ELSEWHERE INTHE WESTERN HEMISPHERE, AND MAXIMIZE PROTECTION AND CONSERVATION FOR PRIORITY SGCNS. STATE SPECIFICPAGES OF THE GUIDE WILL INCLUDE MULTIPLE MAPS (E.G. SPECIES SPECIFIC, SPECIES GROUPS OF INTEREST)AND PARTNERS AND PROJECT INFORMATION. THE GUIDE WILL ALSO INCLUDE OUTREACH MATERIAL FOR SOUTHERNWINGS AND ANNUAL CYCLE CONSERVATION THAT COULD INCLUDE A STORY MAP, FLIP BOOK, AND ONLINE OUTREACHAND EDUCATION DOCUMENTS WHOSE TARGET AUDIENCES WILL BE STATE AGENCY STAFF AND CONSTITUENCIES. THISINFORMATION WILL ALLOW STATES TO MORE EASILY INCLUDE FULL ANNUAL CYCLE CONSERVATION STRATEGIES INTHE2025 UPDATE OF THE SWAPS.

THE RECENT GROWTH AND POPULARITY OF RECREATIONAL COMPETITIVE SHOOTING SPORTS HAVE CREATED UNPRECEDENTED R3 SUCCESS AND OPPORTUNITIES, PARTICULARLY WITH ROBUST EMERGENCE OF HIGH SCHOOL COLLEGIATE LEVEL SHOOTING TEAMS. YOUTH SHOOTING TEAMS PROVIDE A FERTILE NETWORK FOR MENTORING AND EFFECTIVE R3 SUCCESS INCLUDING LEGITIMATE REACH INTO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES AND INCREASING DIVERSITY WITHIN THE SHOOTING SPORTS COMMUNITY. WITH THIS GROWTH, HOWEVER, COME UNPRECEDENTED PROBLEMS AND NEEDS. THE CAPACITY AND INFRASTRUCTURE FOR FACILITATING EFFECTIVE R3 FOR THE SHOOTING SPORTS ARE LAGGING. HEADWINDS FROM THE PANDEMIC AND ASSOCIATED ECONOMIC STRESSORS ARE THREATENING THE SUSTAINABILITY OF THESE PROGRAMS. THESE FACTORS CLEARLY MANIFEST AS REGIONAL AND NATIONAL R3 THREATS. WITHOUT FOCUSED EFFORT TO ADDRESS THESE HEADWINDS, THE GAINS IN PARTICIPATION AND DIVERSITY THROUGH THESE PROGRAMS ARE AT RISK ALONG WITH THE VERY FUNDING THESE PROGRAMS GENERATE FOR CONSERVATION THROUGH THE PURCHASE OF FIREARMS AND AMMUNITION THAT FLOWS THROUGH THE FEDERAL AID IN WILDLIFE RESTORATION PROGRAM.THROUGH THE PROPOSED PROGRAM, DUCKS UNLIMITED (DU) WILL HELP SUSTAIN AND GROW YOUTH SHOOTING TEAMS BY OFFSETTING PROGRAM COSTS (EQUIPMENT, AMMUNITION, COMPETITION ENTRY FEES AND TRAVEL) BY DEPLOYING FUNDRAISING OPPORTUNITIES THAT CAN BE READILY ADOPTED AND DELIVERED BY YOUTH SHOOTING TEAMS AT THE COMMUNITY LEVEL AND CAN BE READILY SCALED UP ACROSS THE NATION.OVER THE PAST TWO YEARS, DUCKS UNLIMITED DEPLOYED THE TEAM RESOURCES ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (TRAP) TO SUPPORT YOUTH SHOOTING SPORTS TEAMS TO HELP THEM SURVIVE THE FINANCIAL CHALLENGES ASSOCIATED WITH THE PANDEMIC AND BROADER ECONOMIC HEADWINDS. TRAP PROVIDES ALL THE INGREDIENTS NECESSARY FOR A TEAM TO CONDUCT A SUCCESSFUL FUNDRAISING RAFFLE AT NO COST TO THE TEAM. DU IS PASSING ALONG FULL ACCESS TO HIGHLY DISCOUNTED MERCHANDISE PACKAGES, PROFESSIONALLY DESIGNED MARKETING FUNDRAISING MATERIALS (POSTERS, RAFFLE TICKETS, SHIPPING MERCHANDISE TO WINNERS), AND GUIDANCE SUPPORT FROM PROFESSIONAL FUNDRAISING STAFF. THE TEAM RETAINS ALL FUNDS RAISED ABOVE THE COST OF DEEPLY DISCOUNTED MERCHANDISE. DU RECEIVES NO FUNDING THROUGH THIS PROGRAM FROM SHOOTING TEAMS.WITH THE SUCCESS OF THIS PROGRAM OVER THE PAST TWO YEARS, DU IS PREPARED TO ACCELERATE THE PROGRAM IN THE KEY STATES OF WI, MI, MN, IL, IN BY ADDING BOOTS ON THE GROUND SUPPORT. COORDINATORS WOULD ENGAGE COACHES  ATTEND 2 TEAM COMPETITIONS  PROMOTE THE PROGRAM THROUGH SOCIAL MEDIA, DU MAGAZINE (2.6M READERSHIP), AND THE DU WEBSITE  PROMOTE MENTORED HUNTS THROUGH DU S 57,000 MEMBER VOLUNTEER NETWORK AND STATE LEVEL R3 PROGRAMS  CONNECT PARTICIPANTS TO DU HIGH SCHOOL AND COLLEGE VOLUNTEER CHAPTERS  AND BUILD R3 MENTORING NETWORKS THAT TRANSLATE DIRECTLY TOWARDS FULFILLING STATE WILDLIFE AGENCY MISSIONS.FUNDING FROM THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE THE SEED MONEY TO HIRE FIVE NEW  RECRUITERS  FOR THE PROGRAM TO SUPPLEMENT OUR ON THE GROUND STAFF OF THREE. WITHOUT CRITICAL FUNDING FROM THE MULTI STATE CONSERVATION GRANT PROGRAM, DU WOULD ONLY BE ABLE TO ADD ONE TEAM MEMBER NEXT YEAR, IF THAT.THE BEST PROOF AND VALIDATION OF THE NEED FOR THIS PROGRAM AND POTENTIAL TO ACHIEVE OUTCOMES UNDER R3 CAPACITY AND INFRASTRUCTURE, IS THE TREMENDOUS GROWTH IN PARTICIPATION AFTER LAUNCHING TRAP. OVER THE FIRST TWO YEARS, PARTICIPATION GREW FROM 37 TEAMS TO 158 TEAMS  22 STATES TO 33 STATES  AND 1,400 TO 5,200 YOUTH PARTICIPANTS.

THERE IS A CLEAR AND PRESENT NEED FOR RESEARCH THAT SCIENTIFICALLY FORECASTS FUTURE HUNTING AND FISHING PARTICIPATION AND SOUNDLY CONVEYS HOW PARTICIPATION CHANGES ARE GOING TO AFFECT STATE WILDLIFE AGENCIES. PREVIOUS ITERATIONS OF THE FUTURE OF HUNTING AND FISHING PROJECT (CHASE, 2012; CHASE 2017) INDICATED THERE IS A COHORT OF INDIVIDUALS, CURRENTLY IN THEIR MID-50S, THAT ARE CONSISTENTLY MORE LIKELY TO HUNT AND FISH REGARDLESS OF THE CURRENT YEAR OR THEIR CURRENT AGE. HOWEVER, THIS COHORT IS AGING TO THE POINT WHERE THEY WILL PHYSICALLY NO LONGER BE ABLE TO PARTICIPATE IN OUTDOOR RECREATION. AS A RESULT, HUNTING AND FISHING PARTICIPATION IS PROJECTED TO DECLINE, ALONG WITH ASSOCIATED PURCHASES, AND AT THIS POINT, CONSERVATION'S FISCAL STABILITY WILL LIKELY BE CHALLENGED.THE NEW FUTURE OF HUNTING AND FISHING PROJECT IS A FIVE-YEAR UPDATE ON PAST RESEARCH ON NATION-WIDE HUNTING AND ANGLING TRENDS. IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS, R3 EFFORTS HAVE INCREASED SIGNIFICANTLY IN VOLUME AND EFFICACY, PERHAPS CHANGING THE TIDE OF FUTURE HUNTING AND ANGLING NUMBERS. IN ADDITION, THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC ALLOWED FOR MORE DISCRETIONARY TIME AND INSTIGATED A RETURN TO NATURE. WE INTEND TO CONDUCT AN AGE-PERIOD-COHORT ANALYSIS ON NATIONWIDE HUNTING AND FISHING DATA TO UPDATE PAST PREDICTIONS OF LICENSE VOLUME, AND TO IDENTIFY HOW CONTEMPORARY INFLUENCES SUCH AS R3 EFFORTS AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC HAVE ALTERED PREVIOUS PREDICTIONS. THIS STUDY WILL PROVIDE STATE FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES AND INTERESTED STAKEHOLDERS WITH THE INFORMATION REQUIRED TO MAKE IMPENDING FINANCIAL AND BUSINESS DECISIONS.

WE WILL USE FOCUS GROUP AND SURVEY RESEARCH TO DEVELOP A SYSTEMATIC MARKETING APPROACH TO ATTRACT NEW HUNTERS BY DEVELOPING AND UNDERSTANDING THEIR CONSUMER JOURNEY (THE STEPS INDIVIDUALS TAKE TO BECOME HUNTERS). THIS UNDERSTANDING CAN THEN BE USED TO INFORM MORE EFFECTIVE MARKETING PLANS AND CREATE NECESSARY EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS. ARMED WITH THE UNDERSTANDING OF THE ADULT-ONSET HUNTER TARGET AUDIENCE THAT WE DEVELOPED WITH THE 2021 MULTI-STATE GRANT, THIS PROJECT WILL UNCOVER THE PROCESS AN INDIVIDUAL FOLLOWS FROM THE FIRST TIME THEY BECOME AWARE OF HUNTING AS A POTENTIAL ACTIVITY, THROUGH TRAINING AND LICENSING, AND ALL THE WAY TO SELF-IDENTIFYING AS A HUNTER. WE WILL BEGIN BY CONDUCTING 8 FOCUS GROUPS AMONG NEW, ADULT-ONSET HUNTERS WHO MEET THE CRITERIA OF THE PERSONAS CREATED IN THE 2021 PROJECT (2 FOCUS GROUPS FOR EACH PERSONA). THESE FOCUS GROUPS WILL UNCOVER DEEP INSIGHTS AND DETAILS ABOUT THE CONSUMER JOURNEY THESE PEOPLE TOOK TO HUNTING. WE WILL USE THE FOCUS GROUP RESULTS TO INFORM A SURVEY INSTRUMENT, WHICH WILL BE SENT TO A MUCH LARGER GROUP OF INDIVIDUALS MATCHING EACH OF THE FOUR NEW HUNTING PERSONAS. THE SURVEY WILL TEST AND VERIFY THE DRAFT CONSUMER JOURNEY ASSUMPTIONS ACROSS A MUCH LARGER, REPRESENTATIVE DATA SET. STATE AGENCIES AND THEIR R3 PARTNERS CAN THEN USE THESE PERSONAS AND VALIDATED CONSUMER JOURNEYS TO INCREASE THE ACCURACY AND EFFICIENCY OF THEIR MEDIA SPENDS, IMPROVE THE FOCUS OF THEIR EDUCATION/TRAINING EFFORTS, AND INCREASE THEIR RELEVANCE WITH THESE NEW, DIVERSE AUDIENCES THAT WANT TO FIND THEIR WAY INTO HUNTING. ONCE WE HAVE COMPLETED THE NEW HUNTER JOURNEY MAP, WE WILL DEVELOP A SHORT, USER-FRIENDLY REPORT THAT DESCRIBES THE RESULTS AND HOW STATE AGENCIES CAN USE THEM TO MORE EFFECTIVELY TARGET "NEW-ADULT" HUNTERS. THIS REPORT WILL BE CIRCULATED TO R3 AGENCIES AND ORGANIZATIONS. IN ADDITION, RESULTS WILL BE PRESENTED TO RELEVANT AFWA COMMITTEES (EOD, HUNTING AND SHOOTING SPORTS PARTICIPATION, ETC.) AT THE AFWA ANNUAL MEETING AND THE NORTH AMERICAN WILDLIFE AND NATURAL RESOURCES CONFERENCE, THE NATIONAL R3 SYMPOSIUM AND THE ASSOCIATION OF CONSERVATION INFORMATION. PROJECT RESULTS WILL BE DISSEMINATED TO AS MANY R3 AND WILDLIFE COMMUNICATORS AS POSSIBLE.

THE NORTHEAST ASSOCIATION OF FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES (NEAFWA) HAS PROPOSED THE PROJECT, CONNECTING DIFFERENT CULTURES TO HUNTING AND FISHING THROUGH FOOD, TO CREATE AWARENESS OF HUNTING AND FISHING AMONG UNDERREPRESENTED AUDIENCES. HARVESTING AND COOKING WILD GAME IS A SIGNIFICANT MOTIVATION FOR PEOPLE WHO WANT TO START HUNTING AND FISHING BUT THERE IS A LACK OF CONTENT THAT SHOWCASES HOW TO USE WILD GAME IN ETHNICALLY DIVERSE CUISINES AND RECIPES. THIS PROJECT WILL FILL THIS NEED BY CREATING 15 HIGHLY PROFESSIONAL COOKING VIDEOS AND ASSOCIATED RECIPE CARDS OF FOOD RECIPES FROM AROUND THE WORLD INCLUDING ASIA, SOUTH AMERICA, AFRICA, THE CARIBBEAN AND MORE. THE GOAL IS TO CREATE HELPFUL "HOW-TO" CONTENT THAT WILL INCREASE THE AWARENESS OF HUNTING AND FISHING TO UNDERREPRESENTED AUDIENCES BY FEATURING RECIPES THAT REFLECT CUISINES FROM DIFFERENT ETHNIC GROUPS. THIS PROJECT WILL WORK WITH A VIDEO PRODUCTION COMPANY TO DEVELOP MODERN COOKING VIDEOS THAT APPEAL TO A YOUNGER AUDIENCE AND ARE SIMILAR TO "TASTY" VIDEOS WHICH GENERATE 500 MILLION VIEWS PER MONTH. NEAFWA WILL WORK WITH OTHER AFWA REGIONS TO IDENTIFY DIVERSE HUNTERS AND ANGLERS WHO CAN PROVIDE CULTURALLY AUTHENTIC FOOD RECIPES AND WHO CAN SHARE THEIR STORY ABOUT HUNTING AND FISHING. THESE VIDEOS WILL PROVIDE MANY PEOPLE WITH AN OPPORTUNITY FOR THE FIRST TIME TO SEE THEMSELVES AND THEIR CULTURES REFLECTED IN HUNTING AND FISHING CONTENT. CORRELATING PRINTABLE RECIPE CARDS WILL BE CREATED ALONG WITH CONTENT THAT HIGHLIGHTS THE STORIES BEHIND THE RECIPES, ADDITIONAL FOOD PREPARATION TIPS, AND A SUGGESTED CONTENT CALENDAR. ALL 50 STATE WILDLIFE AGENCIES WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT BECAUSE THE PRODUCTS WILL BE AVAILABLE ON THE R3 CLEARINGHOUSE AND WILL BE FULLY EDITABLE TO ADD BRANDING AND CALLS TO ACTION. THIS PROJECT WILL SEEK TO WORK WITH AN EXPERIENCED VIDEO PRODUCTION COMPANY AND PROFESSIONAL CHEFS, IF NEEDED. THE END RESULT WILL BE A CATALOG OF EYE-CATCHING VIDEOS AND CONTENT THAT BETTER REPRESENTS THE NEW AND DIVERSE AUDIENCES THAT CAN BE RECRUITED INTO HUNTING AND FISHING.

IN 2020, THE NUMBER OF VIRTUAL HUNTER AND ANGLER EDUCATION PROGRAMS INCREASED SIGNIFICANTLY. VIRTUAL PROGRAMS CAN SERVE MANY MORE PEOPLE THAN IN-PERSON EVENTS, CAN BE SCALED TO MEET DEMAND, AND HAVE SIGNIFICANTLY LOWER COSTS PER ATTENDEE THAN IN-PERSON CLASSES. AS IN-PERSON CLASSES RESUME, STATES ARE ASKING "WHICH FORMAT - VIRTUAL OR IN-PERSON - IS MORE EFFECTIVE IN CREATING NEW HUNTING AND FISHING LICENSE BUYERS, AND WHEN IS EACH APPROPRIATE?"THIS PROJECT WILL ANSWER THAT QUESTION BY COMPARING THE PERCENT OF VIRTUAL AND IN-PERSON EVENT PARTICIPANTS WHO PURCHASED LICENSES WITHIN A YEAR OF THE EVENT. PURCHASE RATES WILL BE EXAMINED OVER MULTIPLE YEARS, INCLUDING 2020, AND DIFFERENCES WILL BE EXPLORED BY TYPE OF EDUCATION PROGRAM (FISHING, HUNTER EDUCATION, ADVANCED SKILLS TRAINING, ETC.), AGE, REGION AND MORE.PARTICIPANTS WILL BE SURVEYED TO IDENTIFY IF VIRTUAL OR IN-PERSON METHODS ARE PREFERRED AND THE PROS AND CONS OF EACH. THE RESULTS WILL DRIVE THE DESIGN AND MIX OF FUTURE STATE AGENCY AND NGO EDUCATION EFFORTS. WITHOUT ANSWERS TO THESE QUESTIONS, FUTURE STATE AND NGO EDUCATION PROGRAMS WILL NOT ACHIEVE THEIR MAXIMUM POTENTIAL.

TITLE:EXPANDING RELEVANCY TO INCLUDE MORE DIVERSE AUDIENCESABSTRACT:THE ARCHERY TRADE ASSOCIATION (ATA) WILL CONDUCT FOUR (4) PHOTOSHOOTS TO CREATE AUTHENTIC BOWHUNTING AND OUTDOOR LIFESTYLE FOCUSED IMAGERY THAT REFLECTS A MORE DIVERSE AND INCLUSIVE DEMOGRAPHIC. THE PHOTOSHOOTS WILL BE LOCATED IN DIFFERENT REGIONS OF THE COUNTRY TO REFLECT VARIOUS LANDSCAPES AND TYPES OF HUNTING. ATA STAFF WILL HIRE LOCAL PHOTOGRAPHERS AND MODELS, SPECIFICALLY BOWHUNTERS, CREATE SHOT LISTS, VIDEO SHOOTS AND EDITING PRIOR TO RELEASING THE IMAGES FOR USE BY STATE AGENCIES AND OTHERS. THE ATA WILL WORK WITH EACH AFWA REGIONAL R3 COMMITTEE TO DETERMINE A LOCATION FOR THE PHOTOSHOOT AND ATA STAFF WILL OVERSEE EXECUTION. EACH PHOTOGRAPHER WILL PROVIDE A PHOTO RELEASE ALLOWING ACCESS AND RIGHTS TO ALL THE IMAGES.

ACADEMICS AFIELD (AA) IS A COLLEGE FOCUSED HUNTING RECRUITMENT PROGRAM. AA HAS BEEN IMPLEMENTED AT EIGHT DIFFERENT UNIVERSITIES IN THE SOUTHEAST AND HAS DEMONSTRATED SUCCESS AND REVEALED UNIQUE OPPORTUNITIES FOR RECRUITING NEW HUNTERS FROM NON-TRADITIONAL BACKGROUNDS (E.G., WOMEN, YOUNG ADULTS FROM URBAN AREAS). HOWEVER, MORE CAN BE DONE TO DIVERSIFY THE POPULATION OF YOUNG ADULTS WHO PARTICIPATE IN THESE PROGRAMS. THIS PROJECT WILL EXTEND AND EXPAND THE EFFECTIVE AA PROGRAM MODEL TO FOCUS ON HISTORICALLY BLACK COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES (HBCUS) ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN UNITED STATES.GEORGIA WILDLIFE FEDERATION IN PARTNERSHIP WITH NORTH CAROLINA STATE UNIVERSITY WILL LEVERAGE OUR EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS, EXPERIENCE, AND TO IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS THE UNIQUE CONSTRAINTS FACED BY AFRICAN AMERICANS. BY IMPLEMENTING SURVEYS AND INTERVIEWS WE HOPE TO FURTHER UNDERSTAND AND THEN CREATE VIABLE OPPORTUNITIES TO MAKE HUNTING AND SHOOTING SPORTS MORE RELEVANT AND INCLUSIVE FOR STUDENTS OF COLOR.GEORGIA WILDLIFE FEDERATION AND SUBRECIPIENT PARTNERS WILL HOST PROGRAMS AT CORRESPONDING ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS. PROGRAM IMPLEMENTORS WILL SELECT STUDENTS TO PARTICIPATE IN AA FOR THE WHOLE SCHOOL YEAR. EACH PROGRAM HOSTS 3-4 LEARN TO HUNT WORKSHOPS A YEAR. EACH PROGRAM IS ORGANIZED BY A STUDENT INTERN (WITH SUPPORT AND OVERSIGHT FROM ACADEMIC FACULTY ADVISORS, SUPERVISORS FROM PARTNERING GOVERNMENTAL AND NON-GOVERNMENTAL ORGANIZATIONS). EACH WORKSHOP FOCUSES ON A DIFFERENT SPECIES AND INCLUDES A THOROUGH TRAINING ON THE HISTORY OF HUNTING, SPECIES BIOLOGY, FIREARM SAFETY AND USE. THEN STUDENT PARTICIPANTS JOIN STUDENT COACHES ON A GUIDED HUNT WITH A CORRESPONDING GAME MEAL TO CELEBRATE THE EXPERIENCES. HUNTS ARE GUIDED BY STUDENT COACHES TO ENCOURAGE COMMUNITY BONDS AND FUTURE HUNTING OPPORTUNITIES. IN ADDITION, BY WORKING WITH EXISTING HUNTERS WE CAN FURTHER PASS ON THE EDUCATION, RESPONSIBILITY AND ETHICS OF THE PROGRAM. PARTNERSHIPS AMONGST STATE WILDLIFE AGENCIES, CONSERVATION ORGANIZATIONS, INDUSTRY AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS ARE RELIED UPON TO ENSURE ALL CURRICULUM AND SAFETY STANDARDS ARE MET. PARTNERSHIP WITH NORTH CAROLINA STATE WILL ENABLE STRONG EVALUATION EFFORTS TO MEASURE OUR IMPACT AND ENSURE DATA-DRIVEN DECISIONS REGARDING PROGRAM IMPROVEMENTS.WE ARE EXPECTING TO ENGAGE HUNDREDS OF STUDENTS IN AA INCREASING PARTICIPATION IN HUNTING IN SHOOTING. WE ARE EXPECTING TO CONDUCT A RESEARCH INVESTIGATION UNDERSTANDING COMMON BARRIERS OF UNDERREPRESENTED AUDIENCES. WE ARE EXPECTING TO ENGAGE DOZENS OF ORGANIZATIONS AND PARTNERS ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST TO SUPPORT AA IMPLEMENTATION. AFTER IMPLEMENTATION AND ANALYSIS, WE WILL PRODUCE AN ADDENDUM TO THE GENERAL AA PRACTITIONER'S GUIDE FOCUSING HUNTER AND SHOOTER RECRUITMENT EFFORTS FOR STUDENTS OF COLOR.ACADEMICS AFIELD WILL HAVE UNTOLD POSITIVE IMPACTS. IN ADDITION TO INCREASING PARTICIPATION IN HUNTING AND SHOOTING SPORTS IT WILL HELP UNDERREPRESENTED AND HISTORICALLY MARGINALIZED POPULATIONS FORGE A STRONGER POSITIVE RELATIONSHIP WITH THE OUTDOORS, HUNTING, AND WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT AGENCIES. STUDENTS FROM ALL BACKGROUNDS WILL BENEFIT FROM SKILL DEVELOPMENT, MENTOR IDENTIFICATION AND A GREATER UNDERSTANDING OF WILDLIFE CONSERVATION. UNIVERSITIES AND COLLEGES WILL BENEFIT FROM THE RESOURCES AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR THEIR STUDENTS. STATE WILDLIFE AGENCIES WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED RELEVANCY WITH UNDERREPRESENTED POPULATIONS. THIS WILL IMPROVE NATIONAL EFFORTS TO IMPROVE DIVERSITY, EQUITY AND INCLUSION IN THE OUTDOORS AND THE WILDLIFE CONSERVATION COMMUNITY.

THE HUNTERS CONNECT PROGRAM HAS BEEN CREATING NEW HUNTER YOUTUBE CONTENT FOR JUST OVER TWO YEARS. DURING THATTIME, YEAR-ONE FUNDING CAME FROM PRIVATE STARTUP CAPITAL WHICH HELPED LAUNCH THE R3 PLATFORM MOVING IT FROM ANIDEA TO REALITY QUICKLY. TO CONTINUE THE WEEKLY CREATION OF NEW HUNTER VIDEO CONTENT A SECOND YEAR, AND ALIGN ITMORE CLOSELY WITH STATE AGENCY NEEDS THROUGH THE ESTABLISHMENT OF AN ADDITIONAL ONLINE SERVER RESOURCE FOR AGENCYUSE, FUNDING WAS ACQUIRED THROUGH AN R3 MULTISTATE CONSERVATION GRANT WHICH CONCLUDES IN SEPTEMBER OF 2021. BYTHAT TIME, HUNTERS CONNECT WILL HAVE CREATED OVER 145 PUBLISHED HOW-TO, TUTORIAL STYLE HUNTING VIDEOS. ONE OF THEORIGINAL GOALS OF THIS PROGRAM WAS TO CREATE A LIBRARY OF EDUCATIONAL HUNTING CONTENT FOR THE INDUSTRY TO USE THATREPRESENTED SAFE PRACTICES FROM A TRUSTED SOURCE. THAT GOAL HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY MET AND THEREFORE IT IS TIME TOPIVOT THIS PROJECT BY ESTABLISHING NEW GOALS AND TACTICS AIMED AT AUDIENCE EXPANSION AND ENGAGEMENT.ALTHOUGH YOUTUBE HAS BEEN THE PRIMARY OUTLET FOR HUNTERS CONNECT VIDEOS, THE ADDITION OF A SPECIAL ACCESS BYNDERSERVER, SPECIFICALLY FOR STATE AGENCY USE, HAS INCREASED VIEWERSHIP AS WELL. THIS ADDITIONAL RESOURCE WAS PART OF THERECENT MSCG FUNDING AND ALLOWS AGENCIES THE ABILITY TO DOWNLOAD ALL HUNTERS CONNECT CONTENT AD FREE AND READY FOROFFLINE USE FOR HUNTERS EDUCATION COURSES, IN MARKETING CAMPAIGNS, AND FOLLOW-UP EMAIL CORRESPONDENCE WITH HUNTEREDUCATION GRADUATES. THESE NEW OPTIONS HAVE BEEN USED BY MANY STATES INCLUDING NEW YORK, LOUISIANA, IDAHO, ANDWYOMING JUST TO NAME A FEW. SPECIAL VIDEO PROJECTS HAVE BEEN CREATED BY THE HUNTERS CONNECT PLATFORMSPECIFICALLY FOR STATE AGENCIES UNDER THE RECENT GRANT INCLUDING LANDOWNER RELATIONS VIDEOS, AND A TRAPPING VIDEOSERIES. THIS HAS ALL LED TO A COMBINED 4.9 MILLION IMPRESSIONS, 235,324 VIEWS, 8,746 COMBINED WATCHED HOURS, AND9,600+ ACTIVE SUBSCRIBERS TO THE YOUTUBE CHANNEL. THIS PROPOSAL SEEKS TO ENGAGE WITH NEW AUDIENCES IN MULTIPLEWAYS TO DRIVE THESE NUMBERS MORE EFFICIENTLY THROUGH NEW CHANNELS AND WITH MORE DIVERSE PARTNERSHIPS.THIS YEAR'S PROPOSED OUTPUT WOULD BE 26 NEW VIDEOS ON YOUTUBE (DOWN FROM 52 PER YEAR IN 2020) PLUS 104 NEWSOCIAL MEDIA CLIPS FROM EXISTING CONTENT FOR THREE NEW PLATFORMS INCLUDING FACEBOOK, INSTAGRAM, AND LINKEDIN.THESE ADDITIONAL SOCIAL MEDIA OUTLETS REQUIRE CONTENT IN DIFFERENT FORMATS AND LENGTHS TO BE SUCCESSFULLY SHARED WHILEYOUTUBE PRIMARILY RELIES ON A USER SEARCHING FOR THE CONTENT USING KEYWORDS.SIMPLY ADDING MORE CONTENT COULD ASSIST WITH GROWING THE EXISTING AUDIENCE OF THIS R3 PROGRAM, BUT THIS MODIFIEDSTRATEGY OFFERS ADDITIONAL EFFICIENCY BY INCREASING ITS ABILITY TO DIRECTLY SHARE VIDEO CONTENT WITH TARGETED AUDIENCESTHROUGH NEW PARTNERSHIPS FOCUSING ON DIVERSE HUNTING POPULATIONS. THESE SAME PARTNERS WILL BE HELPING TO DIRECT THECREATION OF NEW CONTENT PRODUCED BY HUNTERS CONNECT AND ALL CONTENT CREATED BY THIS MODIFIED CONTENT STRATEGY WILLBE AVAILABLE TO STATE AGENCY TEAMS IN THE RECENTLY ESTABLISHED BYNDER PLATFORM.BY ALTERING TYPES OF VIDEO CONTENT MADE, ADDING ONLINE PROMOTION, AND TARGETING AUDIENCES HUNTERS CONNECT WILLINCREASE VIEWERSHIP AND ENGAGE DIVERSE PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS.

MUCH HAS BEEN ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH RESEARCH AND LOCALIZED PROJECT DEVELOPMENT TO MORE COMPLETELY UNDERSTANDTHE BEST APPROACHES TO MENTORING. FEDERALLY FUNDED PROJECTS SUCH AS "MAKING MENTORSHIP WORK" AND "CREATING AHUNTING MENTOR COMMUNICATION TOOLKIT" WERE SUCCESSFUL IN UNCOVERING BOTH PROS AND CONS TO PREVIOUSLY ATTEMPTEDMENTOR PROGRAMS AS WELL AS IDENTIFYING MISSING ELEMENTS THAT WOULD LIKELY HAVE MADE FOR A MORE SUCCESSFUL PROGRAM. THIS PROPOSAL SEEKS TO WORK ALONGSIDE THE TEAMS RESPONSIBLE FOR THESE PREVIOUS PROJECTS WITH THE ADDITIONOF A FEW KEY ORGANIZATIONS TO BUILD A NATIONALLY SCALED, INCLUSIVE EDUCATIONAL PLATFORM THAT APPEALS TO MENTORS ANDVOLUNTEER EDUCATORS FROM EVERY STATE AND REGION.IN 2021, MAFWA RECEIVED A MSCG TO CREATE A "HUNTING NETWORK" SOFTWARE PROGRAM WITH ENOUGH FUNDING TO BUILDTHE INITIAL MINIMUM VIABLE PRODUCT TO BEGIN THE NATIONAL PROJECT. FUNDING FROM THIS PROPOSAL WILL FINALIZE THEBUILDING OF THIS MARKET-READY SOFTWARE AND ITS ABILITY TO OFFER STATE AGENCIES AND OTHER PARTNER-EDUCATIONALORGANIZATIONS THE OPPORTUNITY TO AID IN THE CONNECTION OF INTERESTED MENTORS WITH RECENT STUDENTS OF HUNTER EDUCATION PROGRAMS AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC INTERESTED IN LEARNING HOW TO HUNT. UPON COMPLETION, ALL STATE AGENCIES WILL HAVE ACCESS TO THE SOFTWARE AND ITS EDUCATORS TO MATCH WITH NOT ONLY INTERESTED MENTEES, BUT ALSO OTHER GROWING EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES WHERE VOLUNTEER INSTRUCTION IS BENEFICIAL. EACH VOLUNTEER IN THE PROGRAM WILL BE OFFERED CONTINUED EDUCATION COURSES TO MAINTAIN THEIR ENGAGEMENT AND GROWTH IN THE PLATFORM. THEY WILL BELONG TO ANATIONAL COMMUNITY OF EDUCATED, PASSIONATE VOLUNTEERS WITH THE ABILITY TO CONTRIBUTE TO MULTIPLE EDUCATIONALOPPORTUNITIES AND INCREASE THEIR ABILITY TO IMPACT NEW HUNTERS. NEW HUNTERS WILL BE ABLE TO IDENTIFY SAFE,TRUSTWORTHY, MENTORS, COACHES, AND INSTRUCTORS RELEVANT TO THEIR INDIVIDUAL NEEDS, WITHIN THEIR STATE OR REGION, THROUGH THE PROGRAM FROM THE COMFORT OF THEIR HOMES. EACH MENTEE WILL BE ABLE TO HAVE CONFIDENCE IN THE NEW SYSTEM BECAUSE OF ITS AUTHORITATIVE BACKBONE OF RECOGNIZED PROFESSIONAL ORGANIZATIONS AND STATE AGENCIES.ESTABLISHING PROGRAM SUSTAINABILITY IS INTEGRAL TO THE SUCCESS OF THIS PROGRAM BEYOND AVAILABLE MSCG FUNDING. THISPROPOSAL INCLUDES METHODS TO CREATE THIS SUSTAINABILITY THROUGH STRATEGIC PLANNING WITH DJ CASE & ASSOCIATES,IHEA-USA, JOURNEYAGE, AND NORTHWAY OUTDOORS IN 2022.

HUNTING PLAYS A CRITICAL ROLE IN CONSERVATION, AND DELTA WATERFOWL BELIEVES THAT FUTURE WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT PROFESSIONALS WHO EXPERIENCE WATERFOWL HUNTING FIRSTHAND ARE MORE LIKELY TO MAINTAIN A STRONG FOOTING AMONG THE WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT COMMUNITY AT NATIONAL, STATE/PROVINCE, AND LOCAL LEVELS. THE UNIVERSITY HUNTING PROGRAM, LAUNCHED IN 2017, PROVIDES THESE STUDENTS WITH A FIRSTHAND HUNTING EXPERIENCE AND EQUIPS THEM WITH A MORE HOLISTIC VIEW OF HUNTING AND CONSERVATION. THROUGH UHP, DELTA AIMS TO PROVIDE STUDENTS WHO DO NOT HAVE A HUNTING BACKGROUND (I.E., NONHUNTING WILDLIFE DEGREE MAJORS) WITH HANDS-ON PARTICIPATION IN THE NORTH AMERICAN MODEL OF WILDLIFE CONSERVATION-THE WORLD'S MOST SUCCESSFUL SYSTEM OF POLICIES AND LAWS TO RESTORE AND SAFEGUARD FISH AND WILDLIFE AND THEIR HABITATS THROUGH SOUND SCIENCE AND ACTIVE MANAGEMENT. WHILE UHP IS A POWERFUL EDUCATIONAL TOOL, IT IS EQUALLY EFFECTIVE AS A HUNTER RECRUITMENT TOOL, WITH THE VAST MAJORITY OF PARTICIPANTS CONTINUING TO HUNT AFTER PARTICIPATION IN THE PROGRAM. FUNDING PROVIDED BY THE MULTI-STATE CONSERVATION GRANT WILL HELP US EXPAND THE PROGRAM BY FUNDING 36 UNIVERSITIES BRINGING US TO A TOTAL OF 50 UNIVERSITIES. THIS WILL ALLOW US TO ACHIEVE OUR DUAL GOAL OF RECRUITING AND EDUCATING 500 WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT STUDENTS OF THE CRITICAL RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN HUNTING AND CONSERVATION.

DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF A LEARN TO HUNT UPLAND GAME DIGITAL COURSE TO STRENGTHEN STRATEGIC R3 EFFORTS OF DIVERSE HUNTERS.PROJECT ABSTRACT:THE LONG-TERM DECLINE IN SMALL GAME HUNTER PARTICIPATION IS A SERIOUS NATIONAL CONSERVATION CONCERN THAT WILL REQUIRE A COORDINATED EFFORT TO ADDRESS. SMALL GAME LICENSE SALES ARE A SIGNIFICANT CONTRIBUTOR TO CONSERVATION FUNDING AND PROVIDE A MAJOR OPPORTUNITY FOR GROWTH. IN LESS THAN 6 YEARS AFTER PEOPLE GRADUATE FROM HUNTER EDUCATION PROGRAMS, OVER HALF WILL STOP HUNTING AND BUYING LICENSES DUE IN PART TO A LACK OF SUPPORT AND NEED FOR CONTINUED EDUCATION. THOUGH A FEW BASIC ON-LINE RESOURCES HAVE BEEN CREATED BY VARIOUS STAKEHOLDER GROUPS, MORE SPECIFIC ASSETS ARE NEEDED TO SUPPORT THE GROWING VOLUME OF THOSE INTERESTED IN UPLAND GAME HUNTING. AT PRESENT THERE IS A GAP BETWEEN STATE HUNTER ED COURSES FOCUSED ON CERTIFICATION AND COMPLIANCE, AND THE IN THE FIELD PRACTICAL UNDERSTANDING OF UPLAND HUNTING. PHEASANTS FOREVER AND KEY PARTNERS WILL STRATEGICALLY BUILD A LEARN TO HUNT UPLAND GAME DIGITAL COURSE THAT WILL BE FREE OF CHARGE, AND THE STREAMING PLATFORM WILL BE ACCESSIBLE TO ALL R3 PRACTITIONERS TO UTILIZE NATIONWIDE BEYOND BOUNDARIES. THESE SELF-SUSTAINING ONLINE RESOURCES CAN IMPROVE THE RECRUITMENT, RETENTION, AND REACTIVATION OF HUNTERS BY REACHING LARGE DIVERSE POPULATIONS IN A MUCH MORE CONVENIENT AND EFFECTIVE FORMAT. GIVEN THE QUALITY PRODUCTION OF HIGH-DEF VIDEOS, THE MODULES GENERATED IN THIS PROJECT WILL BE USEFUL TO AGENCIES AND PARTNERS FOR MANY YEARS TO COME, ALLOWING THE GRANT TO CONTINUE DELIVERING ITS MISSION LONG-TERM.JUST AS IMPORTANT TO ADDRESSING THE GAPS OF ONLINE EDUCATION RESOURCES, THE NECESSITY TO ENGAGE NEW AUDIENCES IS A STRATEGIC PRIORITY OF THIS PROJECT. THE HUNTING COMMUNITY CURRENTLY LACKS DIVERSITY AND CLEAR AVENUES FOR WOMEN AND ETHNICALLY DIVERSE POPULATIONS TO JOIN ITS RANKS. THE PROPOSED MODULES WILL BE INTENTIONAL, REPRESENTATIVE, AND WELCOMING TO PEOPLE OF DIVERSE BACKGROUNDS TO HELP OVERCOME CULTURAL AND SOCIAL BARRIERS WITH UNDERREPRESENTED COMMUNITIES. THIS PROJECT WILL STRATEGICALLY EMPLOY RELATABLE CONTENT CREATED WITH, BY, AND FOR A DIVERSE GROUP OF SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS TO BE AUTHENTIC AND HAVE LASTING BENEFITS. THESE RESOURCES HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO EXPONENTIALLY INCREASE THE EFFICACY OF ATTEMPTS TO INVOLVE A BROADER CONSTITUENT BASE IN OUTDOOR RECREATION, WITH CONSIDERABLY MORE PARTICIPANTS THAN WHAT OUR IN-PERSON WORKSHOPS HAVE CAPACITY TO DO.OUR PRIMARY GOAL IS TO ADAPT TO THE NEEDS OF CHANGING DEMOGRAPHICS, ALLOWING US TO MEET INDIVIDUALS WHERE THEY ARE AT TODAY, AND CREATE A SIMPLE PATHWAY BY GIVING PARTICIPANTS THE NECESSARY KNOWLEDGE AND CONFIDENCE TO PREPARE THEM FOR SUCCESSFUL IN-PERSON HUNTING EXPERIENCES. THE ONLINE COURSE WILL GIVE INDIVIDUALS THE NEEDED EDUCATION, AND CHALLENGE THEM TO USE THESE APPLIED SKILLS TO BECOME SELF-SUFFICIENT HUNTER-CONSERVATIONISTS AND ADVOCATES OF OUR LAND, WATER, AND WILDLIFE.

EXPLORING THE MOTIVATIONS AND DETERRENTS OF WILDLIFE POACHERS, THE TRUE CONSERVTION COSTS OF WILDLIFE CRIME, AND DEVELOPING AN APPROACH TO ENSURE RESTITUTION, FINES, AND PENALTIES FIT THE CRIME.FEW STUDIES HAVE HOLISTICALLY EXAMINED THE CONSERVATION IMPACTS FROM WILDLIFE POACHING. THESE IMPACTS INCLUDE THE LOSS OF DESIRABLE GENETIC MATERIAL, LOSS OF OPPORTUNITY FOR HUNTERS, AND LOST REVENUE FOR AGENCIES. TRAGICALLY,THE VISIBILITY AND NOTORIETY OF POACHING ALSO EXACERBATES THE TENDENCY OF THE PUBLIC TO EQUATE "POACHING" WITH "HUNTING," FURTHER DEGRADING THE POSITIVE CONSERVATION BENEFITS DERIVED FROM LAWFUL HUNTING. WHILE THERE IS EVIDENCE INDICATING THAT DETECTION RATES FOR POACHING ARE ASTONISHINGLY LOW, ACCURATELY ESTIMATING THE NUMBER OF UNDETECTED VIOLATORS IS PROBLEMATIC. HOWEVER, THESE DATA ARE CRITICAL IN UNDERSTANDING THE IMPACTS THAT POACHING ULTIMATELY HAS ON PUBLIC TRUST RESOURCES. LIKEWISE, DETERMINING WHY POACHERS CHOOSE TO VIOLATE WILDLIFE LAWS IS CRITICAL FOR ESTABLISHING ADEQUATE PUNITIVE CONTROLS THAT ULTIMATELY WILL HELP TO REDUCE OR DETER POACHING. YET, LITTLE EMPIRICAL DATA EXIST ON WHAT MOTIVATES INDIVIDUALS TO POACH. AND WHILE STATES HAVE STATUTES AND REGULATIONS THAT ASSIGN PENALTIES AND RESTITUTION FOR POACHING, THE GREATEST IMPACT IS AFFORDED WHEN THOSE LAWS ARE CONSISTENT, DATA-SUPPORTED, AND FAIRLY ENFORCED BY PROSECUTORS AND JUDGES. THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS STUDY ARE TO 1) QUANTIFY THE DETECTION RATES OF POACHING ACTIVITIES ACROSS THE U.S., 2) DETERMINE THE MOTIVATIONS THAT CAUSE POACHERS TO TAKE WILDLIFE ILLEGALLY, 3) DETERMINE THE DEGREE TO WHICH JUDGES AND PROSECUTORS PURSUE AND ISSUE FINES AND PENALTIES THAT ARE PROPORTIONAL TO THE CONSERVATION VALUE OF POACHED WILDLIFE, AND 4) PROVIDES TATE WILDLIFE AGENCIES WITH RECOMMENDATIONS, BASED ON THE RESULTS OF THIS STUDY, TO BETTER INFORM THEM ON BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES FOR EFFECTIVELY REDUCING RATES OF ILLEGAL TAKE OF WILDLIFE. THESE RECOMMENDATIONS MAY INCLUDE SUGGESTIONS FOR CONSISTENCY IN FINES, PENALTIES, AND REPLACEMENT COSTS FOR POACHED WILDLIFE AS WELL AS RECOMMENDATIONS FOR IMPROVING THE DETECTION AND CONVICTION OF CRIMINALS THAT TAKE WILDLIFE ILLEGALLY.

RESEARCH AND ANALYSIS OF POLICY AND LAW TO PREVENTTRANSLOCATION OF FERAL SWINETHE WILLFUL OR ACCIDENTAL INTRODUCTION OF FERAL SWINE INTO SUITABLE HABITATS ACROSS NORTH AMERICA IS PERHAPS ONE OF OUR MOST SERIOUS CONSERVATION ISSUES. INCONSISTENCIES IN STATE POLICIES AND LAWS REGARDING THE TRANSPORT/TRANSLOCATION OF FERAL SWINE UNDERMINE STATE AGENCIES' EFFORTS TO PREVENT EXPANSION AND REDUCE THE IMPACT OF THESE ANIMALS. THE NEWLY FORMED AFWA FERAL SWINE WORKING GROUP HAS DEFINED AS ITS PRIORITY TO "ENCOURAGE UNIFORM POLICIES THAT PROHIBIT THE INTERSTATE MOVEMENT OF FERAL SWINE AND TRANSLOCATION OF FERAL SWINE." UNDER THIS GRANT, WMI WILL WORK WITH OUR STATE AND PROVINCIAL PARTNERS TO RESEARCH THE POLICIES, REGULATIONS, AND STATUTES (BOTH WILDLIFE AND AGRICULTURE) OF ALL 50 STATES AND ADJACENT CANADIAN PROVINCES REGARDING THE TRANSPORT AND TRANSLOCATION OF FERAL SWINE. WE WILL ANALYZE THE DATA TO IDENTIFY INCONSISTENCIES, GAPS, AND TRENDS THAT HAMPER THE ABILITY OF AGENCIES TO EFFECTIVELY CONTROL THE SPREAD OF FERAL SWINE. WMI WILL ALSO ASSESS THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THESE POLICIES, REGULATIONS, AND STATUTES FOR THEIR ABILITY TO EFFECTIVELY CONTROL THE MOVEMENT AND SPREAD OF FERAL SWINE. FINALLY, WMI WILL DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS FOR REVISIONS TO STATUTES, REGULATIONS, OR POLICIES TO INCREASE CONSISTENCY AND IMPROVE DESIRED OUTCOMES REGARDING THE CONTROL OF FERAL SWINE. A FINAL REPORT WITH THE ANALYSIS OF THE CURRENT STATUS OF FERAL SWINE STATUTES, REGULATIONS, AND POLICIES WILL BE PROVIDED TO ALL 50 STATES AND CANADIAN PROVINCIAL WILDLIFE AGENCIES. THIS REPORT WILL ALSO CONTAIN RECOMMENDATIONS FROM WMI BASED ON CURRENT DATA TO IMPROVE THE ABILITY OF STATES AND PROVINCES TO EFFECTIVELY MANAGE THE MOVEMENT OF FERAL SWINE. WMI WILL ATTEND MEETINGS AND REPORT THE FINAL WORK PRODUCT TO THE AFWA FERAL SWINE WORKING GROUP, NATIONAL WILD PIG WORKING GROUP, SEAFWA AND MAFWA WILD PIG WORKING GROUPS, AND INDIVIDUAL STATE AND PROVINCIAL AGENCIES UPON REQUEST.
