PHASE 3-TEST, LAUNCH AND EDUCATE: NATIONAL MARKETING CAMPAIGN TO INCREASE CULTURAL SUPPORT FOR, AND PARTICIPATE IN, HUNTINGPROJECT ABSTRACTBUILDING OFF OF THE SUCCESS OF M-MSCGP GRANTS AWARDED FOR 2020 AND 2021, A COALITION OF CONSERVATION COMMUNITY PARTNERS - LED BY NWTF - IS DEVELOPING A NATIONAL ADVERTISING CAMPAIGN TO INCREASE CULTURAL SUPPORT FOR, AND EVENTUALLY PARTICIPATION IN, HUNTING AS A LIFESTYLE CHOICE. ONCE COMPLETE, THE CONSERVATION COMMUNITY WILL BE EQUIPPED WITH A VARIETY OF MARKETING ASSETS THAT CAN BE USED IN ONLINE AND OFFLINE CHANNELS. THESE CAMPAIGN ASSETS CAN ONLY BE EFFECTIVE IF THEY ARE PLACED INTO THE VIEW OF THE PUBLIC AND THE BROADER CONSERVATION COMMUNITY IS TRAINED ON THEIR PROPER USAGE.FOR THE CAMPAIGN TO REACH ITS MAXIMUM POTENTIAL, A FULL-SCALE NATIONAL MEDIA BUY WILL BE NEEDED. SUCH AN ENDEAVOR WILL TAKE SIGNIFICANT FUNDING SOURCED FROM MULTIPLE CONTRIBUTORS. TO GET THERE, EACH OF THE FUNDING CONTRIBUTORS WILL NEED TO BELIEVE IN THE PROMISE OF SUCCESS PRIOR TO INVESTING IN THE EFFORT. IN THIS PHASE, WE WILL BUILD THE EVIDENCE THEY NEED BY DEMONSTRATING THE CAMPAIGN'S POTENTIAL VIA MEASUREMENT OF A SMALL-SCALE, NATIONAL LAUNCH. THIS EVIDENCE WILL THEN BE USED TO HELP CONVINCE DONORS, INVESTORS, ADDITIONAL GRANT SELECTION COMMITTEES AND OTHERS THAT THEY CAN CONTRIBUTE WITH CONFIDENCE TO THE COMPLETE FUNDING OF A FULL-SCALE NATIONAL CAMPAIGN.DELIVERABLES, MEASUREMENTS AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLE: ORGANIZATIONAL ENGAGEMENT: CONTRIBUTION OF OWNED DIGITAL CONTENT SPACE BY ACTIVE PROJECT PARTNERS.MEASUREMENT: NUMBER OF PARTNERS CONTRIBUTING DIGITAL CONTENT SPACEEXPECTED OUTCOMES: UNIFIED PARTNERSHIP OF INDUSTRY WIDE, LIKE-MINDED ORGANIZATIONS THAT ARE EDUCATED, ACTIVELY SUPPORTIVE AND ENERGIZED TO HELP PRODUCE THIS SET OF LEARNINGS AND DATA POINTS.DELIVERABLE: ACTIVITY: OUTREACH TO INDIVIDUALS: 50% AIDED AWARENESS AMONG GENERAL POPULATION, AGES 25-55, WHO HAVE BEEN SERVED THE CAMPAIGN ASSETS.MEASUREMENT: KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS VARY BY PLATFORM AND CAN INCLUDE IMPRESSIONS (REACH), CLICKS, POSTS, RESPONSES, PAGE VIEWS, POSITIVE MENTIONS VIA SOCIAL LISTENING, HASH-TAG USAGE, AND NUMBER OF SHARES. WE WILL TRACK AND EVALUATE EACH AD PLACEMENT WITH THE METRICS AND ANALYTICS PROVIDED BY THE PLATFORM UTILIZED.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: LEARNINGS AND DATA POINTS THAT DEMONSTRATE THE LIKELIHOOD OF SUCCESS FOR A FULL-SCALE NATIONAL MARKETING CAMPAIGN.

SUPPORTING UNDERGRADUATE/GRADUATE/LAW STUDENTS' & POST-GRADUATES' EDUCATION & PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE IN CONSERVATION LAW & POLICYPROJECT ABSTRACT:THE CONSERVATION LAW PROGRAM EDUCATES STUDENTS, LEGAL PRACTITIONERS, AND ADDITIONAL AUDIENCES ON CONSERVATION EFFORTS- SUCH AS THREATS TO AMERICANS' RIGHTS TO HUNT AND FISH, AS WELL AS THE ANIMAL RIGHTS MOVEMENT. THIS IS INCREDIBLY IMPORTANT AS DECISIONS BASED ON THE COURT OF PUBLIC OPINION IN LIEU OF SOUND SCIENCE AND APPROPRIATE WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT TOOLS ARE INFLUENCING HOW THE PUBLIC VIEWS WILDLIFE. THE PROGRAM OFFERS STUDENTS, LAWYERS, JUDGES, AND ADDITIONAL INTERESTED PARTIES THE OPPORTUNITY TO LEARN CONSERVATION CONCEPTS, INCLUDING THE NORTH AMERICAN MODEL OF WILDLIFE CONSERVATION AND PUBLIC TRUST STEWARDSHIP IN STATE FISH AND WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT. IN TURN, THE STRENGTHENING OF A LEGAL COMMUNITY BETTER PREPARED TO CONTRIBUTE TO CONSERVATION PROFESSIONALLY BECOMES POSSIBLE.TO CREATE AND MAINTAIN INFORMED CONSERVATION PROFESSIONALS, ADDITIONAL OPPORTUNITIES MUST BE CREATED. BY EDUCATING STUDENTS IN CONSERVATION GRADUATE PROGRAMS AND LAW SCHOOLS, AS WELL AS PRACTICING LEGAL PROFESSIONALS AND OTHER CONSERVATION PROFESSIONALS, THE PROGRAM STRIVES TO FOSTER THE CHANGE NECESSARY TO INFLUENCE AMERICAN DECISION MAKERS BY TEACHING THE FUNDAMENTALS AND IMPORTANCE OF CONSERVATION LAW AND POLICY TO HELP AMERICA'S WILDLIFE AND AMERICANS' RIGHTS.THE CORE OBJECTIVES TO CREATE AND MAINTAIN INFORMED CONSERVATION PROFESSIONALS AS TO THE NORTH AMERICAN MODEL OF WILDLIFE CONSERVATION ARE:1. PROVIDE UNDERGRADUATE/GRADUATE LEVEL EDUCATION: TO MAXIMIZE THE ABILITY TO REACH THE LARGEST NUMBER OF STUDENTS, THE STEADY ADDITION OF WILDLIFE LAW/POLICY COURSES IN NEW STATES/COLLEGES IS IMPERATIVE. ADDITIONALLY, SOME LAW COLLEGES OFFER CROSS OVER COURSES WITH THE LAW COLLEGES AND CONSERVATION MASTER'S OR PHD CURRICULUMS (I.E. MICHIGAN STATE UNIVERSITY AND UNIVERSITY OF WYOMING).2. POST-GRADUATE / SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATION: THE SECOND OBJECTIVE OF THE CONSERVATION FLYWHEEL MODEL FOCUSES ON OFFERING CONTINUED EDUCATION IN THE FORM OF CONTINUING LEGAL EDUCATION SEMINARS AND COMMUNICATION OF PRINCIPLES OF WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT VIA RE-RECORDED VIDEOS ON INTRODUCTORY TOPICS OF WILDLIFE LAW.3. CREATE PROFESSIONAL OPPORTUNITIES: CONCLUDING WITH A PRACTICAL ELEMENT, THE PROJECTS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS CATEGORY ARE COMPILING CONSERVATION-BASED INTERNSHIPS, EXTERNSHIPS, CAREERS, AND EDUCATORS.THE KEY DELIVERABLES ARE AS FOLLOWS: 1. COLLEGES OFFERING WILDLIFE LAW/POLICY, OR SOME VARIATION OR THE COURSE TO ALIGN WITH THE COLLEGE'S SPECIFIC WANTS & NEEDS. 2. STATE BAR ASSOCIATIONS OFFERING CREDIT FOR THE CENTER'S CONSERVATION LAW CONTINUING LEGAL EDUCATION SEMINAR. 3. INFORMATIONAL RECORDINGS ON INTRODUCTORY CONSERVATION/WILDLIFE LAW TOPICS. 4. STUDENTS & GRADUATES PLACED IN CONSERVATION INTERNSHIPS & CAREER POSITIONS.

TITLE:ENSURING THE VIABILITY OF THE AMERICAN SYSTEM OF CONSERVATION FUNDING: IMPROVING THE UNDERSTANDING OF EXCISE-TAX BASED FUNDING FOR CONSERVATION.ABSTRACT:THE WSFR PROGRAM PROVIDES MORE THAN S1 BILLION ANNUALLY TO STATE WILDLIFE AGENCIES, WHICH IN TURN BENEFIT LOCAL ECONOMIES THROUGH WILDLIFE-ASSOCIATED RECREATION, AND GIVES AMERICANS THE OPPORTUNITY TO ENJOY FISH, WILDLIFE, AND THE OUTDOORS. UNFORTUNATELY, THERE IS A GROWING DISCONNECT BETWEEN THE PUBLIC AND THE OUTDOORS. OUR UNIQUE SYSTEM OF CONSERVATION AND THE FUNDING MODEL THAT SUPPORTS IT REMAINS POORLY UNDERSTOOD. IT IS CRITICAL THAT OUR COMMUNITY EFFECTIVELY ENGAGE OUR CUSTOMERS, INDUSTRY, AND THE PUBLIC BY TELLING THE COMPELLING STORY OF CONSERVATION FUNDING. ONLY BY STRENGTHENING RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN INDUSTRY, AGENCIES, AND OTHER PARTNERS, CAN WE EFFICIENTLY PROMOTE OUR CONSERVATION SUCCESS STORIES, AND COLLECTIVELY ENGAGE OUR PARTNERS AND CUSTOMERS TO ENSURE LONG-TERM STABILITY OF CONSERVATION FUNDING. FURTHER, THE LEVERAGING OF PARTNERSHIP RESOURCES WILL HELP TO RAISE AWARENESS AMONG INFLUENCERS AND THE PUBLIC, ALLOWING OUR CONSERVATION MODEL TO FLOURISH FOR DECADES TO COME. THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT WILL CLARIFY THE ROLE THAT INDUSTRIES PARTNERS PLAY IN FISH AND WILDLIFE CONSERVATION, PROMOTE THE BENEFITS OF CONSERVATION TO OUR PARTNERS AND CUSTOMERS, AND RAISE AWARENESS OF KEY INFLUENCERS ABOUT THE ROLE THAT STATES, MANUFACTURERS, AND THE SPORTING PUBLIC PLAY IN WHAT HAS LONG BEEN OUR GREATEST KEPT SECRET AND OUR GREATEST CONSERVATION SUCCESS STORY.

SOCIAL LISTENING FOR RELEVANCY: THERE IS A TIDAL WAVE OF ONLINE CONVERSATIONS GOING ON ABOUT OUTDOOR RECREATION (AND STATE FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES) EVERY MOMENT OF EVERY DAY. THESE CONVERSATIONS WILL GO ON WITH OR WITHOUT THE PARTICIPATION OF THE CONSERVATION COMMUNITY. STATE AGENCIES AND THEIR PARTNERS NEED A TOOL FOR MONITORING THESE CONVERSATIONS TO STAY ABREAST OF TRENDS AND ISSUES IMPORTANT TO THEIR CUSTOMERS, AND TO HELP THEIR CUSTOMERS CONNECT WITH THE OUTDOORS. THIS PROJECT WILL USE SOCIAL LISTENING TOOLS TO MONITOR THESE CONVERSATIONS AND PROVIDE STATES WITH INSIGHTS INTO HOW THEY CAN BETTER MANAGE SOCIAL MEDIA CONVERSATIONS AROUND THEIR BRANDS AND AROUND IMPORTANT CONSERVATION ISSUES. OVER THE COURSE OF A YEAR, RESEARCHERS WILL MONITOR PUBLICLY AVAILABLE SOCIAL MEDIA POSTS FOR CONVERSATIONS THAT MENTION STATE WILDLIFE AGENCIES AND/OR KEY CONSERVATION-RELATED TOPICS, AND WILL SYNTHESIZE RESULTS INTO USEFUL INSIGHTS INTO HOW AGENCIES CAN BETTER MANAGE SOCIAL MEDIA CONVERSATIONS AROUND THEIR BRANDS AND AROUND IMPORTANT CONSERVATION ISSUES. WE WILL ANALYZE THE DATA AND REPORT RESULTS AND TRENDS ABOUT WHAT SOCIAL MEDIA USERS ARE ACTUALLY SAYING ABOUT FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES. WE WILL SEND BIWEEKLY REPORTS TO A DESIGNATED CONTACT IN EVERY STATE, PROVIDING UPDATES ON AGENCY MENTIONS, MAKING IT LAST MENTIONS, CONVERSATIONS USING "GENERIC" CONSERVATION TERMS, AND A LIMITED NUMBER OF CUSTOMIZED QUERIES ON TOPICS OF INTEREST TO THE AGENCIES. ONCE THE SOCIAL LISTENING STUDY IS COMPLETE, A WHITE PAPER AND PRESENTATION WILL BE DEVELOPED AND CIRCULATED TO STATE FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES. WE WILL REPORT ON THE GENERAL TRENDS AND LESSONS LEARNED THROUGHOUT THE YEAR OF MONITORING. PRESENTATIONS WILL BE OFFERED TO RELEVANT AFWA SUBCOMMITTEES, THE NATIONAL R3 SYMPOSIUM AND THE ASSOCIATION OF CONSERVATION INFORMATION. OUR GOAL WILL BE TO GET THE RESULTS INTO THE HANDS OF AS MANY R3 AND WILDLIFE COMMUNICATORS AS POSSIBLE.

TITLE:MODERNIZE THE ORGANIZATION, AUTHORITY AND PROGRAMS OF STATE FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES REPORTABSTRACT:THIS PROJECT WILL REVISE AND UPDATE THE ORGANIZATION, AUTHORITIES AND PROGRAMS REPORT AND PROVIDE TIMELY INFORMATION OF EACH STATE CONSERVATION AGENCY'S ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE; FORMAL AUTHORITIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES; AND ITS PRIORITY PROGRAMS. THE REPORT WILL BETTER INFORM ELECTED AND APPOINTED OFFICIALS, SISTER AGENCIES, THE ASSOCIATION OF FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES AND ITS NATIONAL AND REGIONAL COMMITTEES, NON-GOVERNMENTAL ORGANIZATIONS, THE PRIVATE SECTOR, AND THE PUBLIC TO COLLABORATIVELY SUPPORT IMPROVED CONSERVATION OUTCOMES; WORK TO SECURE STABLE, LONG-TERM FUNDING; AND HELP STATE AGENCIES UNDERSTAND AND ADAPT TO CHANGING SOCIAL CONDITIONS. THIS PROJECT WILL CREATE A MECHANISM TO EASILY GATHER STATE-LEVEL INFORMATION IN DIGITAL FORMAT, AGGREGATE AND ANALYZE THE INFORMATION, AND COMMUNICATE ABOUT THE CHANGES THAT OCCUR OVER TIME TO INCREASE AND IMPROVE THE ABILITIES FOR AGENCIES TO ACHIEVE THEIR CONSERVATION GOALS. INFORMATION ON CURRENT ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURES AND CHANGES TO FORMAL AND INFORMAL AUTHORITIES WILL HELP POSITION STATE CONSERVATION AGENCIES TO ADDRESS CURRENT AND FUTURE CONSERVATION CHALLENGES.THE WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT INSTITUTE (WMI) WILL CONTRACT WITH DJCASE AND ASSOCIATES, INC. TO REVIEW THE SURVEY INSTRUMENT FROM THE PREVIOUS ORGANIZATION, AUTHORITIES AND PROGRAMS REPORT WITH WMI STAFF. THEY WILL WORK COLLABORATIVELY TO DELETE OBSOLETE QUESTIONS AND CREATE NEW QUESTIONS THAT REFLECT AND PROVIDE INSIGHT ON MODERN CONSERVATION ISSUES AND CHALLENGES. CONTRACTOR WILL DESIGN AND BUILD A WEB-BASED INQUIRY PLATFORM THAT WILL ALLOW STATE CONSERVATION AGENCY STAFF TO EASILY ANSWER SURVEY QUESTIONS ONLINE. THE PLATFORM WILL BE DESIGNED TO AGGREGATE ANSWERS IN A SEARCHABLE DATABASE, SO USERS CAN QUERY THE SYSTEM TO SEE HOW OTHER STATES RESPONDED TO THE VARIOUS SURVEY QUESTIONS. CONTRACTOR WILL TEST THE SYSTEM WITH SEVERAL PILOT STATES TO ENSURE EASE OF USE AND DESIRED REPORTING CAPABILITIES AND WILL MODIFY AS APPROPRIATE. THE SEARCHABLE DATABASE AND ONLINE PLATFORM WILL BE HOUSED ON THE WMI WEBSITE AND MADE AVAILABLE FOR ON-DEMAND AGENCY USE.
NATIVE AMERICAN PARTICIPATION RESEARCH AND OUTREACH

ADVANCING IMPLEMENTATION OF THE FISH AND WILDLIFE RELEVANCY ROADMAPPROJECT ABSTRACT:UNDER THIS PROJECT, THE WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT INSTITUTE WILL WORK WITH FOUR STATE FISH AND WILDLIFE AGENCIES TO ADVANCE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE FISH AND WILDLIFE RELEVANCY ROADMAP. THE PROJECT INVOLVES WORKING THROUGH A THREE PHASED PROCESS WITH EACH STATE. PHASE 1 CONSISTS OF AN ASSESSMENT OF THE AGENCY'S READINESS TO ENGAGE WITH PREVIOUSLY UNDER-SERVED CONSTITUENCIES BASED ON AN INTERNAL SURVEY AND DISCUSSIONS WITH AGENCY LEADERSHIP, IDENTIFICATION OF DEMOGRAPHIC OR GEOGRAPHIC POPULATION SEGMENTS OF INTEREST THAT HAVE BEEN UNDER-SERVED BY THE AGENCY, AND QUALITATIVE SOCIAL SCIENCE RESEARCH CONDUCTED BY INNOVATIVE OUTCOMES, INC. TO BEGIN TO DEVELOP AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE POPULATION SEGMENT(S) OF INTEREST. PHASE 2 CONSISTS OF A QUANTITATIVE SURVEY OF THE STATE'S GENERAL POPULATION AND/OR THE POPULATION SEGMENT(S) OF INTEREST CONDUCTED BY RESPONSIVE MANAGEMENT, INC. TO IDENTIFY THEIR WILDLIFE-RELATED NEEDS, INTERESTS, AND CONCERNS, AND THEIR AWARENESS OF AND TRUST IN THE STATE WILDLIFE AGENCY. PHASE 3 USES THE RESULTS OF THE EARLIER PHASES TO DEVELOP A SET OF RELEVANCY GOALS, OBJECTIVES, STRATEGIES, AND EVALUATION CRITERIA THE STATE CAN APPLY TO ENGAGE AND SERVE THE POPULATION SEGMENT(S) OF INTEREST. TO DATE, CONNECTICUT, NEVADA, AND OKLAHOMA HAVE AGREED TO PARTICIPATE IN THE PROJECT. A FOURTH STATE FROM THE SOUTHEASTERN REGION OF THE COUNTRY WILL BE SELECTED IN THE NEAR FUTURE.
